loans.name: Clayris

texts.es:
La señora Clayris es una persona honesta y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Doña Clayris es muy conocida y visitada por los vecinos de su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, entre otras que necesita para surtir más de producto su negocio.
Doña Clayris espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios, además desea un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. Ella espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2013
texts.en:
Clayris is an honest and hardworking person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and their 2 children. Her business has been a convenience store for 5 years.

Clayris is very well known and visited by the residents of her community. She is asking for the loan to buy corn, lard, eggs, cheese, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, and more that she needs to stock more products in her business. 

Clayris hopes that the loan will help her a lot since she doesn't have a lot of necessary items. In addition to earning more income, she wants to benefit her family's quality of life at home. She hopes to grow her business and keep supporting her children in their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life. 



Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lard, eggs, beverages, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat and  juice for her business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет одного ребёнка. Но со своей семьёй Дилбар живёт в родительском доме, вместе со своими родителями, так как они пенсионеры и нуждаются в заботе. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание Дилбар занимается купли продажей золотых изделий. Для ведения этого бизнеса она имеет специальную торговую точку. Также Дилбар имеет собственную столовую, где приготавливают плов и шашлык, от этого бизнеса у неё также есть стабильный дополнительный доход. Так как Дилбар закупает золотые изделия в другом городе, который находится далеко, она хочет приобрести собственную машину для перевозки своего товара, чтобы облегчить и более обезопасить процесс перевозки. Для этого Дилбар обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку машины. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Dilbar is a happy and responsible woman. She is married and has one child. Dilbar lives with her family and her parents in their home because they are elderly and need support. Dilbar buys and sells gold goods to make a living. She has a special vendor location where she runs her business. Dilbar also has her own eatery where plov (pilau rice and meat) and shish kabob is made and has a stable additional income from this business as well. Because Dilbar buys gold goods in another town which is located far away she wants to buy her own car to bring merchandise and make the transportation process easier and more safe. She has come to Arvand for this reason and wants to get a loan to buy a car. Dilbar hopes for a positive outcome and is thanking Arvand for support in advance.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабире 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Сабиры - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Сабира занимается животноводством сразу же после распада союза, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 1 нетель, 28 овец, также имеет земельный надел, мерою 2,40 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sabira is 56 years old, she is married and is raising two children with her husband. Sabira has higher education and works as a teacher in school. As an additional income for her family Sabira's family started animal husbandry with a purchase of livestock for 10,000 KGS right after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Because of her hard work Sabira now has one milk cow, one horse, one calf, one heifer and 28 sheep as well as a plot of land in the size of 2.40 hectares where she annually grows beans, potato and perennial grasses. Her monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). With the goal to further grow her business Sabira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy calves to increase the headcount of livestock. Sabira plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of livestock and also save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: José Omar es un señor de 49 años de edad, habita en Mangua y ha procreado dos hijas con su esposa, él actualmente trabaja durante las horas de la noche en un restaurante y por el día apoya a su esposa en el manejo del hogar y la familia, él está consciente que una de sus dos hijas de 10 años de edad aun se encuentra en etapa escolar, requiriendo esto mucho esfuerzo de su parte. Don José solicita el crédito para realizar un pequeño anexo en la parte frontal de su actual vivienda, considerando que la existente es insegura y no presta las óptimas condiciones para habitarla, para tal actividad necesita realizara la compra de materiales de construcción como: bloques, acero, cemento, arena, hierro, piedras canteras y el pago de  mano de obra.
texts.en: José Omar is a 49 year old man. He lives in Managua  and has two daughters with his wife. Right now he works nights at a restaurant and during the day he helps his wife manage the home and the family. He is aware that one of his two daughters is ten and still school aged and this requires a lot of work from him. José is asking for the loan to build a small addition on the front part of the his house. He thinks it is unsafe now and that it does not have optimal living conditions. For this e needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, steel, cement, sand, iron and quarry stone, as well as to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, steel, cent, sand, iron, and quarry stone, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build an outside wall for greater security.

loans.name: Iago

texts.en:
Iago is a 36-year-old married man with two children living in the town of Rustavi, near the capital city. His wife works as a hair stylist at the beauty salon and Iago is an operator at the petrol station. The couple gets monthly salaries and their income is $270.  

As the existing income is not big enough for the four-member family, Iago decided to earn additional income and purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Iago applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $1300  will help Iago to start a taxi business. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them inter-city.  Iago is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to provide his children with a good education for progress in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Iago is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Tabernaculo De David Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios emprendedores uno de ellos es Elda mujer de 27 años, acompañada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de enchiladas, frescos, platanitos y hamacas desde hace 2 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para mejoras para la casa y compra de materia prima como canasto de plátanos, aceite, leña y hamacas . Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. Rosa mujer de 38 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y Angel hombre de 38 años su negocio es un taller de calzado.
texts.en: The group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Elda, a woman of 27, who is married with two young children.  She has worked selling enchiladas, fresh fruit, plantain chips and hammocks for 2 years.  She is seeking the loan to make improvements to her home and to buy raw materials such as banana baskets, oils, wood and hammocks. She will soon have been a client of the institution for 1 year.  Rosa, who is 38, works selling tamales and Angel, who is a man of 38, makes footwear.

loans.use: to make improvements to their home and to buy raw materials such as banana baskets, oils, wood and hammocks.

loans.name: Aguas Verdes Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas es Odily  tiene la edad  de 27 años, acompañada, con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de pinolillo, pinol, tamales  desde hace 4 años, el  crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los productos como quintal de maíz, leña, cacao, clavo de olor, canela, queso, dulce, etc. Paula tiene la edad de 46 años su negocio es una mini pulpería desde hace 3 años además, vende comida como tacos, enchilada, vigoron, Juana tiene 30 años su negocio es la venta de frutas desde hace 17 años.
texts.en: The group is made up of three hardworking members, one of whom is Odily, who is 27 and married with a young child.  She has been selling pinolillo ( a cornmeal and cocoa drink) and tamales for 4 years.  She is applying for the loan to buy raw materials to make goods such as 100lbs of corn, wood, cocoa, cloves, cinnamon, cheese, sweetmeats, etc.  Paula, who is 46, has run a small grocery shop for 3 years and additionally sells tacos, enchiladas and vigorón (cabbage salad).  Juana, who is 30, has been selling fruit for 17 years.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary for the production of goods: 100lbs of corn, wood, cocoa, cloves, cinnamon, cheese, sweetmeats, etc.

loans.name: Almendrito Group

texts.es: Grupo Formado por cuatro socias luchadoras una de ellas es Patricia mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio  y venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace 15 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo solicita  para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar ropa, papel higiénico, café, gaseosas, etc. Argentina mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos  por catálogo de Avon, Maritza mujer de 48 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y una mini pulpería  y Jenny mujer de 33 años su negocio es venta de verduras.
texts.en: The group is made up of 4 determined members, one of whom is 30-year-old Patricia, who is married with a young child.  She runs a grocery shop from her home and has been selling fruit and vegetables for 15 years.  She will soon have been a client of the institution for 4 years.  She is applying for the loan to buy basic grains such as rice and sugar, oil, washing powder, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, etc.  Argentina is a woman of 31 who sells Avon cosmetics, Maritza is a woman of 48 who sells new clothing and runs a small grocery shop and Jenny is a woman of 33 who sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and sugar, oil, washing powder, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members, all women and all responsible for their families. They come from Teshie which is located in the coastal zone of the country. These people are characterized by being hard working, responsible, and wanting to excel. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and were obligated to work from a young age in order to help with the household expenses.

Comfort has been selling wax-print fabric for twenty-four years. She does this work 8 hours daily on foot. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with different fabric of wax-prints so that in the not too distant future, she can obtain better income. 
ID Ghana is appreciative of the support of Kiva investors.

They will need a total loan of GHS 5,200 to buy enough stock to sell and make enough profit.

loans.use: to purchase different wax-print fabric so that in the not too distant future, she can obtain better income.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 46, is single and residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of the Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and making Khmer Noodles to sell. Skhorn is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 23,000 KHR each day each day after daily expenses. 
Sokhorn’s group consists of two members who are both female and have both been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sokhorn completely paid back her previous loan with VisionFund and successfully used the loan to better support her family. She and her group member are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Sokhorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on making Khmer Noodles. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of charcoal.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas Flor mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como la chicha, pinol, pinolillo desde hace 10 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de  inventario como maíz por quintal, leña, cacao, rodamina, bolsas, vainilla, frambuesa. Ana mujer de 56 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de verduras, perecederos y María  mujer de 39 años de edad su negocio es la venta de derivados del maíz como pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members. Flor is one of them. She is 24 years old, single, and has had a business selling maize-based products such as chicha, pinol and pinolillo, which are regional beverages, for 10 years. She has been a client of the institution for one year. She is requesting a loan to buy stock such as quintales of maize, firewood, cocoa, rhodamine, bags, vanilla and raspberries. 

Ana is 56 ayears old, and has a business selling vegetables and perishable food items, and Maria is 39 years old and has a business selling maize-based products such as pinol and pinolillo.

loans.use: to buy stock such as quintales of maize, firewood, cocoa, rhodamine, bags, vanilla and raspberries.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva  is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother).  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and a bag of rice. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of merchandise from Kampala city to her shop. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked shop and also to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, so this loan will help her get closer to those goals. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.    Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and bags of rice.

loans.name: Anasthase

texts.en:
Anasthase is 41 years old. He has six children aged between three months and 18 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels and allow her to sell greater quantities of rice porridge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony is 41 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She lives in the Sa Ang District of Kandal Province. She and her husband raise cassavas. With several years' experience in this business, she earns up to $9 a day and saves $5 a day.
 
Sony is requesting her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to pay her son’s tuition fee to study the Korean language. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Fatema

texts.fr:
Fatema est une jeune marchande de 30 ans, mariée. Son activité consiste à vendre des produits cosmétiques dans un marché de la place ou elle a ouvert une cantine depuis 4 ans. Elle est à son 2ème crédit à l’IMCEC ; et pour cette fois ci, elle veut doubler la somme pour augmenter son stock. Elle va acheter  des crèmes de beauté, des parfums, du savon, du lait pour le corps et des tissus. Elle commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 19h 
Elle n’a  pas  de charges et les bénéfices liés à son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et leur confort matériel.
texts.en:
Fatema is a young businesswoman who is married and 30 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics in a local market where she has had a stand for 4 years. She is on her second loan with IMCEC; for this one, she wants to double the loan amount to increase her stock.

Fatema will use the loan to purchase beauty creams, perfumes, soaps, body lotions, and fabric. She begins her day at 10am and works until 7pm. She does not have anyone in her care and the profits from her business will allow her to improve the food conditions of her family and their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and fabrics for resale

loans.name: Fatou Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Fatou est une commerçante qui évolue dans la commerce des bijoux tels que les boucles d'oreilles, les bagues, les bracelets et les colliers. Elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans son activité, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Fatou sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son stock de marchandises et satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir elle souhaite avoir une cantine au marché pour exploiter d'avantage son activité.
texts.en: Fatou has a business selling jewelry such as earrings, rings, bracelets, and necklaces. She has more than 3 years of experience in her business; she is married and the mother of a family. Fatou is requesting this loan to increase her stock of merchandise and to meet the needs of her customers. She begins her day at 8am and works until 7pm. In the future she hopes to have a stall in the market to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry, earrings, rings, bracelets, and necklaces to resell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is 43 years old, widowed, and has three children, one of whom attends school. To make a living, she has been working in a garment factory. To supplement her income, she also farms rice. Having been in these businesses for 11 years, Phalla is able to earn about 45,000 KHR aday to meet the family’s needs; she saves about 25,000 KHR a day after deducting daily expenses. 

Phalla’s group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. Phalla is requesting her eighth loan from VisionFund.  The other group member is requesting her second loan. Phalla, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la restauration et cela depuis plus de 14 ans. Madame Anta a besoin de ce crédit d’un montant de  100 000 F pour diversifier son activité en achetant des habits destinés à la vente pour ses  clients. Elle commence sa journée à 7h du matin pour rentrer à la maison vers 23h du soir. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir un grand restaurant et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants
texts.en:
Anta is a married woman and the mother of a family. She has been in the restaurant business for more than 14 years. She needs this loan of 100,000 francs CFA to diversify her business by purchasing clothing to sell to her customers.

Anta begins her day at 7am in the morning, and returns home around 11pm at night. She helps her husband with the daily expenses and the schooling costs of her children. In the future she hopes to have a large restaurant and to increase her revenue, in order to be able to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell to her customers who come into her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio, 45, is from the town of Panglao,  Bohol. He is married with 4 children aged 16, 13, 11 and 9. He raises and sells hogs as a source of income. His hog-raising business started 2 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy pig feed in order for the pigs to grow healthy in a particular period so that he can sell them to meet the family's needs.

In the future, Julio hopes to expand his hog-raising business and increase business profitability for his children’s education, as well as improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter’s university fees .

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien, 44, is married with five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. He will use this Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Kimeab's Group

texts.en: A mother of five children residing in Battambang province, Kimeab is 39 years old and strives to make a living via rice and bean farming. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for others for a fee during his spare time. This is the business that she has had for ages and she can get almost 33,000 KHR to cover the daily food consumption in her family. With this new loan, Kimeab has had five loans with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions, especially to be able to have three decent meals each day. For this cycle, she teamed up with a group of five to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the harvesting fees for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield during the replanting season and double her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the harvesting fee for her crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased number of pots and pans which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s school fee and the study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of salted fish, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer luchadora de 63 años, casada, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 30 años, su marido y ella se encarga de la tierra para sembrar, tiene 10 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para la compra frutas como ayote, elote, pipián, quequisque, insumos para sembrar maíz y yuca como abono, semillas.
texts.en: Francisca is a 63 year old woman who is a fighter. She is married and has 3 children under her care. Her business has been selling vegetables in the Masaya market for 30 years. She and her husband prepare the land for planting. She has been a client of the institution for 10 years. She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables such as ayote, corn, and squash, as well as materials to plant corn and yucca, such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and such as ayote, corn, squash, and quequisque, as well as materials to plant corn and yucca such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, 34, has three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible wife and a mother. She engages in her daily routine work, and she has to do all tasks alone, and that is why she becomes so tired daily. She has to look after her young children and old parents.  

She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she could feel easy and relaxed. But her husband’s job is unsatisfactory for getting high income.

Her husband owns a medical clinic in which he provides immediate services to the patient. (In case of emergency he refers his patients to the hospital.) He has been practicing with a professional MBBS doctor; now he owns his own small clinic on the basis of his experience. He has been treating his patients, and his patients are getting recovered as well. He has become very famous in the society and wants to establish his clinic through the latest medical equipment, but he does not have the capital.

Therefore, Rehana requested a loan for her husband. She hopes that her husband will be able to buy medical equipment and medicine so that he can earn maximum profit.
 
Rehana hopes that through the profit, she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: To buy medical equipment and medicines for the health clinic.

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.en:
Mathieu is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. He will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming activities back into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell to customers.

Ma. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is a 46-year-old single woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is engaged in 'buy and sell' businesses. She buys and sells empty coconut shells. Aside from this, she raises hogs to help augment the income of her household. Her two businesses started almost 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, additional piglets and empty coconut shells.

 In the future, Ediltrudes hopes to expand both  businesses and increase business profitability for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, additional piglets and empty coconut shells

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 39 years old. He is a father of five children aged between 10 and 19. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase onions and limes

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chheang is 36 years old and married.  She has three children who are still in school. To sustain her living, she and her husband do rice farming as their main source of income which has returned her about 37,000 KHR per day.  This is the fifth loan for Chheang and the second loan for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 1,500,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can minimize the loss due to pests and produce a better crop than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is from Mrgavet village of Ararat region. She lives with her mother and grandmother. Naira and her mother work in the Ministry of Emergency Situations. Their salaries, however, as so low, that they cannot afford a living based on their salaries alone. To be able to meet the costs of her family, Naira is engaged in cultivation of wheat, cabbage, alfalfa and several fruits (peach, apricot, plum and pear). Farming is an important source of income for the family. In order to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Naira needs a loan of 3,000 USD to pay for harvesting services, to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer, to buy cellophane for the greenhouse, and to renovate the greenhouse. The family highly relies on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for helping them to collect the needed amount of loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting services, to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer, to buy cellophane for the greenhouse, and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is 42 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the capital city suburb. His wife works as babysitter and earns small monthly salary. Konstantine hires a car and serves the locals as a taxi driver, earning the family's main income.  

The car owner plans to sell the car and Konstantine wishes to buy it. He is requesting a loan for $1,400, which will enable him to continue his taxi business and earn a good income. He is a very experienced driver and hard working person with a great desire to ensure that his children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize for kenkey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega is single with five children and all her children go to school. She has one additional family member (mother). She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent for the shop. 

She operates a retail shop from the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people. She has been in business for five years. She works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and soap. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, sugar, beans, rice, flour, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 47 years old. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela is a 28-year old lady; she is married and spending her life with her daughters and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She is taking a loan for her husband because her husband owns an embroidery shop. He has been running this business for many years, now he has become very expert in his profession. He knits very fine embroidery over bridal dresses. 
The embroidery material for the bridal dresses is very expensive but he has a very high turnover. Now due to the marriage season, the demand for bridal dresses has increased and he is very conscious to continue knitting for the bridal dresses in order to support their family. Due to high costs he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to knit the fine embroidery. 
Therefore, Raheela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could overcome the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount her husband will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.
Raheela is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloths, threads, sequins and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell more fried tilapia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yams, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en: This time, Norie is borrowing a new loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more groceries to sell to customers. Her general store business was previously funded through NWTF, Kiva's field partner, and it continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat..

Sandra successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Sandra's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her clothing business.

loans.name: Apauline

texts.en:
Apauline is 50 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have five children. 

She has been a maize farmer for six years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and suppport labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dress-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her dress-making business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 46 years old and married with one child. Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Juliet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 51 years old and a married woman.  She is a hardworking mother of three who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past two years. She  knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, originally from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is 56 years old and married. She is blessed with six children. To struggle for a living, she does rice farming on two hectares as her main source of income. The business, which she has been involved in for ages, generates about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Yan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She utilized her first loan and paid back completely The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle and do better than before. For this cycle, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan. Yan will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for her farmland. She truly believes that she can make more income so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Zorina

texts.en:
Zorina is 42 years old and married with one kid.

Zorina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Zorina has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and earns an income from selling used shoes.

Zorina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is an experienced agronomist from the village of Masis in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and her son. To earn a living, Gohar is engaged in raising two pigs, and in cultivation of tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, alfalfa, and some fruits (peaches, apricots, plums, blood oranges and apples). Farming is the main source of income for the family. 

Gohar's husband and son help her greatly in getting the agricultural produce to the local market. Gohar cultivates plants in two greenhouses. As their needs are growing day by day, she needs to enlarge her agricultural business a little bit, to meet the daily needs of her family more effectively. As this is Gogar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.  

A loan of USD 2000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to build another greenhouse and to develop their agricultural business further. The family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed amount of the loan to develop their business.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Candelaria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from general store. Candelaria is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Candelaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran, age 23, is a married woman and a mother of two children.  She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future.  Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However due to low funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. 

Kiran intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, thread, laces and zippers to create a means of increasing her revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.  Kiran wants to utilize her earned profits on her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, thread, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three members of micro businesses. One of whom is Janet, a 44-year-old woman with a husband and two children of 14 and 10 years of age. She has been selling Jewelries and slipper in her community for thirteen years, and has been a client of this institution for three. 

She needs this loan amount of GHS 1,000 to buy jewelries to sell, since Christmas festivities are approaching. Her customers want to buy ornaments for the celebration. Janet is standing in the middle of the photograph.

Ruth and Christiana are the other members, and both are 50-year-old women who runs pastries, and sanitary and dippers business respectively.

They would need GHS 2,850 to serve customers better.

loans.use: to buy jewelries to sell, since Christmas festivities are approaching.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been doing a business of clothing sales for many years and is an expert in the field. She buys clothes of different varieties from wholesale markets, and after making beautiful embroidery patterns on them, sells them in her area.  

Her husband is a laborer who was the only earner of the family, and it was very tough for Musarrat to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. She is playing a very important role in the betterment of her family.  

She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors with some spools of thread, beads and sequins, etc., by taking into account the taste and choices of her customers. She wishes to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors with some spools of thread, beads and sequins, etc.

loans.name: Kulshayir

texts.ru: Кулшайыр 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Кулшайыр- высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Кулшайыр занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулшайыр, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулшайыр обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулшайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kulshayir is a 51-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she raised their three children on her own, and also runs their homestead. Kulshayir has a higher education and works as a teacher in a local school. As a source of additional income for her family, Kulshayir is involved in raising livestock, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kulshayir today has on her homestead: two dairy cows, one horse, and one calf. Monthly income consists of 5,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kulshayir turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her livestock count. 

Kulshayir plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is thirty years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Jocelyn requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items, such as diapers, shampoos, sardines and other beverages.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Ma. Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as diapers, shampoos, sardines, and other beverages.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past thirteen years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 80,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Мастура очень трудолюбивый человек и одновременно может заниматься несколькими видами деятельности. Она родилась в маленьком селе города Исфары . Замужем, имеет 3-детей. У нее среднее специальное медицинское образование. Она работает медсестрой в медицинском пункте своего села. 
Еще она занимается откормом скота и по этой деятельности она давно сотрудничает с Арванд, то есть с 2006 года. Откорм скота дает очень хорошую прибыль.
Мастура хочет расширить свой бизнес путем увеличения число скотов. 
 С этой целью она обратилась в Арванд за получением очередного кредита. Она выражает благодарность Арванд за сотрудничество и считает что именно это организация посодействовала ей реализовать ее собственный бизнес.
texts.en:
Mastura is a very hardworking person and can simultaneously engage in several types of activities. She was born in a small village near the town of Isfara. She is married and has three children. She has a specialized secondary medical education. She works as a nurse in the infirmary of her village. 

She is also engaged in fattening cattle and for that activity she has long collaborated with Arvand, that is since 2006. Fattening cattle brings a very good profit.

Mastura wants to expand her business by way of increasing the number of cattle. To this end, she turned to Arvand to get a loan. She is grateful to Arvand for the collaboration and considers that this organization specifically has promoted her to realize her own business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is an experienced agronomist from Kamo village of Shirak region. She lives with her husband, son, and mother-in-law. Astghik's husband and son work in the private sector. Their salaries, however, are not enough to meet the needs of the family. To help them earn a living for the family, Astghik is engaged in cattle breeding and cultivation of potato and grass. 

Farming is an important source of family income. Astghik's husband and son help her greatly in everyday farming activities. As the autumn is progressing, Astghik's agribusiness needs some investments. A loan of USD 2,500 will be very helpful for Astghik and her family, enabling her to purchase some forage, cattle, and alfalfa seeds. 

The family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage, cattle, and alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 36-year-old vigorous married lady. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband outside her house. The man shown in the picture is her husband. 

When the couple started their relationship with Kashf three years ago, their store was small and had very few items. Now the family is living a much better life than before because they are able to meet their expenses easily and maintain a good standard of life. 

They wanted to increase the range of products to increase their profits, but a lack of funds made this almost impossible. Shamim borrowed some funds from Kashf in anticipation of business improvement. Over the passage of time, they have been injecting the store with new items, and now it has become popular in the community. 

They want to increase their inventory, as the population in their neighborhood has increased in the recent years. Now, she has applied for a loan of  25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase stock of juices, milk and grains. They are expecting a boost in their earnings and dream of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of juices, milk and grains.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been running a small business of animal selling with the help of her husband (the man shown in the picture) for the last 10 years. They buy kid goats and calves from the market, and then sell them to the people of their community and in the local market after 2-3 years, when they mature. They are experienced in the field, and have a good approach towards business expansion and savings for future.

But for some time they face losses in their business, so Razia decided to apply for a loan to support her business, and therefore has requested a loan of  PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. They are confident and have good market knowledge to grow their business. They dream of providing better standard of living to the family members through all their hard work in business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 24-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for the past two years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. At present she has two cows in milk. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба доброжелательная и хозяйственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Живёт она в маленьком посёлке. Сама Адиба работает поваром в местной столовой, а её муж работает плотником. Вместе они стараются зарабатывать на достойное проживание для своей семьи и детей, чтобы они получили всё необходимое для жизни. Помимо стабильной работы Адиба ведёт также свой небольшой бизнес - животноводство. Она выращивает скот, а затем продаёт полученное мясо и молоко. Совсем недавно Адиба с мужем начали ремонт своего дома, но не смогли закончить, так как не хватило денежных средств. Но они очень хотят сделать хороший ремонт своего дома, чтобы жить в достойных благоприятных условиях. Поэтому Адиба обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Adiba is a friendly and economical woman. She is married and has children. She lives in a small village. Adiba herself works as a cook at a local dining hall, and her husband works as a carpenter. Together they try to earn a decent living for their family and children, so they get all the necessities of life. Alongside her stable work, Adiba also runs a small business - raising livestock. She raises cattle, and then sells the resulting meat and milk. 

Most recently, Adiba and her husband started to repair their home, but were not able to finish because they did not have sufficient cash. But they really want to make good repairs to their home, in order to live in sufficiently favorable conditions. Therefore, Adiba turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy construction materials to repair her home. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira is 49 years old, widowed, and from the village of Gamarjveba. She lives with her retired parents and grown son. The family earns a living through agricultural business, and breeds a milk cow and ten pigs. Zaira produces cheese with the received milk, and sells it locally. In wintertime, the family will sell the pork and generate income.

Now, Zaira is requesting the loan to purchase broiler chicks and start a poultry farm. The part of the credit will be used for buying feeding for chicks. After 45 days, Zaira will sell chickens for a good price, and invest the funds in the next cycle.
 
The family will have additional source from poultry farming, and they will be able to increase their daily spending.

Zaira hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chicks and start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products for opening a store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Fatuma prepares snacks such as fried potatoes. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase cooking oil, potatoes and wheat flour for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, potatoes and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Elmer Noe

texts.es: Elmer de 36 años de edad se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace varios años por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, las personas lo buscan por la amabilidad y la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo lleva el sustento diario a su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa quien es profesora y sus dos hijos de 12 y un año de edad, Elmer está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  repuestos y llantas para su vehículo ya que ese su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elmer is 36 years old and provides transportation services to the different neighborhoods near his home with his pick-up truck.  People seek him out for his friendliness and responsible driving.   This is how he supports his household.  He lives with his wife, who is a teacher, and her two children, ages 12 and 1.  Elmer is asking for this loan to buy spare parts and tires for his vehicle because this is his only source of work and this is how he is able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future. She also operates a food business, preparing food and selling it to her neighbors.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of leso (women's wrap) cloth for resale

loans.name: Bano's Group

texts.en:
Bano is the age of 41. She is living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a small family, but she has five children. Her husband’s income is not good; this is the reason that sometimes, he fails to provide basic needs for his family.

She is taking a loan for her husband’s painting shop; in fact, her husband provides the services of banner writing for different kinds of advertisements. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and has great practice in banner writing. He uses pieces of cheap cloth, paint and brushes for banner writing. 

He does not have enough stock of paint and cloth to continue his services. Therefore, Bano requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy multi-colored cans of paint, brushes and cloth.
 
Bano says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Bano is representing herself by raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy white cloth, paint and brushes for banner writing.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 37-year-old married woman. She has recently started her business, and been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of three children and motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing, health and education.

Tahira wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a farmer from Gugarq village of Lori region. She lives with her husband, her school-age son, and her parents-in-law. Hasmik's husband is currently in Russia as a labor migrant, to be able to meet the needs of the family. Hasmik breeds a livestock of cows and hens. She also cultivates grass, apples, and pears.

Farming is the most important source of income for Hasmik's family. She realizes the agricultural products in the local market. As autumn is progressing, Hasmik's agribusiness needs some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will help her and her family by greatly enabling them to pay for the harvesting services, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments. 

The family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan, and helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting services, buy some forage for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Durdane

texts.en:
Durdane 34, a married mother of an 11-year-old son, lives with her family in the village of Dilagarda, located in the Füzuli region. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons)  for 20 years. 

Durdane has a few cows, enabling her to sell dairy products including milk, cheese and yogurt in the local bazaar to earn money. Today she is requesting a loan of 1800 AZN to buy cattle.

Durdane is thankful both to Komak and Kiva for help. As a result of the loan her monthly income will increase and she will be able to help her son receive a good musical education in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Cansilde

texts.en:
Cansilde is 44 years old. She is married with five children. She has been a farmer for the past six years. She will use Kiva's loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva's lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ana Evelyn

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 27 años de edad, madre de familia de 3 niños de 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, estudian el nivel básico en la comunidad donde residen. Estudio hasta sexto grado en la comunidad.
Se acompaño con su esposo, hace  13 años, él trabaja haciendo viajes de un pick up, de la comunidad hacia los cantones, caseríos de la comunidad y hacia la ciudad todos los días.

En la casa de habitación, también vive una tía de ella; Ana es la segunda de cuatro hermanos, quienes están en los estados unidos. Solo ella y  sus padres están en el país.

Ana trabaja vendiendo ropa desde muy pequeña, sus abuelos y sus padres la crecieron en el negocio de la venta de ropa. Actualmente vende ropa para niños y adultos en la comunidad y en los caseríos aledaños, también vende de lunes a viernes frutas en la comunidad, los días domingos a veces vende en la cancha de fútbol panes y otros antojitos.

Compra la mercadería (ropa), dos veces al mes, dependiendo de la época, para llegar al lugar le toma una hora y media, en bus urbano.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a  fundación campo, es para comprar ropa para adultos y para niños en el cual invertirá $500.00 y el resto comprara $50.00 de frutas y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de panes para ir a la cancha de fútbol y vender panes con crema y frijoles.
Con ello pretende obtener mayores ingresos económicos, para su  familia, pues actualmente se acerca la época donde hay mayor demanda de ropa.

Su sueño mas grande es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, pues ella no tuvo ese apoyo para haber seguido aprendiendo y desarrollarse en una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman, age 27. She is the mother of a family of three children, ages 12, 10 and 7. They study in the elementary school in the community where they live. Ana studied until the sixth grade in her community.

She lives with her husband of 13 years. He works making trips in a pick-up, from their community to the districts and villages of their community and to the city every day.

Ana’s aunt also lives in their home. Ana is the second out of four siblings, who live in the U.S.  Only she and her parents still live in their country.

From the time she was very young, Ana has worked selling clothing, and her parents raised her in their clothing sales business. Currently, she sells clothes for children and adults in the community and in the adjoining villages. From Monday to Friday she also sells fruit in the community.  Sometimes on Sundays she sells bread and other snacks at the soccer field.

She buys her stock (clothing) twice a month, depending on the season. It takes an hour and a half to get to the place on a city bus.

The loan that she seeks from Fundación Campo is to buy clothing for adults and children. She will invest $500 in this. From the remaining funds, she will buy $50 worth of fruit. She will invest the rest of the money in buying bread to go the soccer field and sell bread with beans and cream.

With the loan she hopes to achieve a larger income for her family, because right now the season in which there is a high demand for clothing is approaching.

Her biggest dream is to support her kids in their studies, because she didn’t have that type of support to continue learning and to develop herself into a professional.

loans.use: to use $500.00 to buy clothing for adults and for children, $50 to buy fruits, and the remaining money to invest in the purchase of rolls, to go to the soccer field and sell bread with beans and cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар с детства всегда мечтала стать врачом. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Медицинский Институт. Ее мечта сбылась, и она стала врачом. Она работает врач – педиатром в городской больнице. Гавхар очень любит свою профессию. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в фотосалоне. Гавхар старается дать хорошее образование своим детям. Ее сын Олимчон учится в Северно- Промышленного Университета Китая. Он учится по специальности экономиста. Гавхар запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gavhar since children has always dreamed of becoming a doctor.  After graduating from high school, she enrolled in the Medical Institute. Her dream came true, and she became a doctor. She works as a doctre – a pediatrician in a city hospital. Gavhar very much loves her profession. 

She is married and has three children. Her husband works in a photo salon. Gavhar is trying to give a good education to her children. Her son Olimjon is studying at the Northern Industrial University of China. He is studying for a degree in economics. 

Gavhar is requesting a loan to pay her son's tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr:
Monsieur BIRANE  est  tailleur depuis 2005 .Il loue un magasin près  du guichet. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Son activité consiste à coudre pour hommes et dames. Il  possède 3 machines  mais cela ne suffit pas car il y a toujours la nouvelle mode qui nécessite d’avoir des machines  qui peuvent faire le travail.
D’ ailleurs le prêt va lui servir à acquérir une nouvelle machine et des tissus pour pouvoir faire fasse à la demande. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille, il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h.
Il a comme charge la location de l’atelier et les frais de scolarité de son enfant de 5 ans. Il souhaite dans l’avenir élargir son atelier  à d’autres activités.
texts.en:
Birane has been a tailor since 2005. He rents a store near the lending branch. He is married and the father of two children. His business consists of tailoring for both men and women. He has 3 machines but this is not enough because there is always a new fashion that requires additional machines to create.

This loan will help Birane purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics to be able to meet his customer's requests. He is in charge of the daily expenses for his family, and begins his day at 9am, ending his work at 8pm. He provides for the rent for his shop and the schooling costs for his 5-year-old child. He hopes in the future to expand his shop into other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make clothes to sell during festivals

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 31-year-old married mother of two daughters and two boys, all of whom attend school. Very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing, Tahira has been selling milk for the past five years. With five calves and two cows, she sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and ghee that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to enable the family to lead a decent life. 

With the help of previous loans, Tahira has improved her business to meet the daily expenses of life. Now in her third year with Kashf Foundation, she has  requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to purchase an additional cow and cattle feed. Tahira hopes to increase milk production in order to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and cattle feed

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 41-year-old married lady and a mother of three.  She has been stitching clothes for the last twenty years. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant and his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason Razia has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. Razia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mopa

texts.en:
Mopa is 57 years old and married. For the past six years, she has operated a cereal shop, selling household consumables such as wheat, rice, and beans. She cites theft and competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Mopa is requesting a loan for 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy wheat, maize, beans, and rice. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary region for growing bananas and sugar cane. He has four children, and he has been doing farm work for 10 years. His primary income sources are selling eggs and other crops.

Ibrahim wishes a loan to buy a dairy cow.  He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Income from selling output." His biggest challenge is "Lack of market." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyabarati."

Ibrahim was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "It has a lower interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Juhudi aims at improving poor peoples lives."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family," Ibrahim replied "Improve their living starndatds."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ibrahim owns the following: poultry but does not own a cow, a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in his household mosquito nets but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Munaza

texts.en:
Munaza is 44 years old, married, and has six children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

Manaza is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons, allowing her to complete the orders of her customers without delay.  She hopes to increase her income and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive junto con sus padres en una casa en anticrético en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

El Nivel de educación de Luz Mabel es de Licenciatura en Leyes, actualmente trabaja como asesora jurídica en una entidad pública de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo requiere para realizar estudios de post grado y asi mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Luz es de tener su casa propia de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Luz is single and doesn’t have children. She lives with her parents in an “anticrético” in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz.
