[An “anticrético” is a property for which the family initially pays a lump sum to the owner, instead of monthly rent.  The lump sum is returned to the family when they leave the house.]

Luz Mabel has an undergraduate degree in Law. She currently works as legal counselor for a public entity in La Paz.

She needs the loan to accomplish her post graduate studies and thus improve her income and quality of life.

Luz’s dream is to have her own house, and in this way to improve her quality of life.

This is the second time she has sought a loan with IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for her postgraduate law studies.

loans.name: Kety

texts.es: Kety, de 27 años, está casada con Huber, ambos tienen 3 hijos con quienes viven en su casa propia. Kety se dedica a la siembra de papa en todas sus variedades. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose al noble oficio de la agricultura, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder, sembrar una nueva variedad de papa, pues según afirma, cada siembra necesita otros cuidados. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Kety, ella también cría corderos, los cuales enseba y vende a mayor cantidad en el mercado de su ciudad. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo ella puede dinamizar sus ventas y su ganancia. Por ello más adelante está pensando en mejorar su producción y comprar más cabezas de ganado. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Kety, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Kety is 27 years old and is married to Huber. They have 3 children who live with them in their own house. Kety earns a living growing all types of potatoes and has been working for 4 years in the noble profession of agriculture. What she likes most about her work is planting a new variety of potato, since according to Kety each variety needs looking after differently. But Kety does not just do this, she also rears sheep, which she fattens up and sells for more money in the city's market. Thanks to her husband's help she is able to keep up her sales and her profits. For this reason she has plans for the future to improve her production and buy more animals.

This is Kety's 6th loan with Kiva, and for this reason she is grateful for the support she has received, which will help her to progress her business. She also promises to pay her instalments punctually. Kety will invest the 600 soles to buy organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Heisel Rubidia

texts.es: Heisel  de 42 años de edad  es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros y venta de yinas (sandalias) su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender,  Heisel está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir aun mas su negocio y tener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Heisel is 42 years old and the single mother of three children.  She lives in a rented house and sells women’s and men’s undergarments and sandals.  Her business is located in the market near her home and she has many customers because of her good prices and friendliness when making her sales.  Heisel is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to better stock her store and increase her profits in order to provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr:
Madame Bousso est une commerçante qui a une bonne connaissance de son domaine d’activité de part le nombre d’année d’expérience : 07 ans. elle démarre sa journée à six heure du matin jusqu’ à 00h. BOUSSO est née en 1975, mariée et mère de famille. Elle vend des denrées alimentaires : oignons, détergeant, des bonbons, et divers  autres marchandises.
BOUSSO demande un crédit de 150000F CFA  pour acheter  les denrées les plus rapides à écouler  comme le sucre, l’oignon, les bouillons, le thé, l'huile...
elle  s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.  Avec les bénéfices de son activité elle a pour projet futur d'ouvrir une alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Bousso is a businesswoman with a good understanding of her particular business area due to her 7 years of experience. She begins her days at 6am and works until midnight. Bousso was born in 1975; she is married and the mother of a family. 

She sells food products: onions, detergent, candy, and various other merchandise. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA to be able to purchase products in order to sell them more quickly, such as sugar, onions, broth, tea, oil, etc. Bousso is in charge of the daily expenses for her family. With the profits from her business her future plan is to open a general foods store.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale such as rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Flor de 41 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y ayuda en el hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 1 año con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Flor quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Flor is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her son who works and helps out in the home. She has had a business selling clothing for 1 year and this has given her a lot of experience which enables her to make better profits. She runs the business from her place of residence and has built up a large clientele because people know that everything is good quality, at affordable prices. 

Flor wants to invest more in the business but she does not have enough capital behind her. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, trousers and everything else necessary for her business. She gives assurances that she will be able to pay off the loan and at the same time she hopes that she will make her household financially secure.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, trousers etc.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: Musrat is 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has a business selling bed sheets to support her family. She always has a great variety of bed covers, spreads, and bed sheets. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for meeting everyday expenses of her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fourth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase a variety of bed sheets, spreads, and pillows in various colors and designs from a wholesale market. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bed sheets, spreads, and pillows in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Wazera

texts.en: Wazera is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves ) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is a married woman with six children who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a business selling lesso cloths (used as wraps for women). She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. She also operates a cosmetics shop.

Bidalla is requesting 40,000 KES to purchase bales of lesso cloth for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of lesso cloth for resale.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo es un campesino de 26 años de edad, que desde muy joven tuvo que hacerse cargo de su madre, pues su padre falleció y él tomó las riendas del hogar. Se dedica a las labores agropecuarias, cría y engorde de animales y producción de leche, pues posee 27 cerdos, 2 vacas productoras de leche y  15 pollos, esta actividad la realiza en la finca arrendada en la que vive con su mamá y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Para generar los recursos económicos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia, él vende los cerdos en diferentes carnicerías y, los pollos y la leche que produce las vende entre los vecinos del municipio donde reside. El empuje, la dedicación y el amor a su familia lo motivan para salir adelante, sobrepasando todas las dificultades y los desafíos que se le presentan. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de lechones para cría y engorde, con el fin de abastecerse y aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en la finca, de esta forma podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada navideña que se aproxima y así podrá incrementar los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Pablo desea seguir trabajando arduamente para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, que sea autosostenible y que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para continuar velando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 26 year-old farmer who has had to take care of his mother from a very young age.  His father died, and so he had to take over the responsibility of the household.  He is a farmer who raises and fattens animals and produces milk.  He has 27 pigs, 2 producing dairy cows, and 15 chickens.  He does this work on a rented farm where he lives with his mother and his little 4 year-old daughter.  In order to generate the resources he needs to support his family he sells pigs to various butcher shops, and he sells the chickens and milk to his neighbors in the municipality where he lives.  

His drive, dedication, and love for his family motivate him to get ahead, overcoming all of the difficulties and challenges that he is presented with.  At this time, Pablo is requesting a loan to invest in pigs to raise and fatten, so that he can increase his livestock and take advantage of the space that he has available on his farm.  In this way he will be able to satisfy the demand, which will increase in the coming Christmas season, and thereby increase the income that he receives from his work.  

Pablo wants to continue to work very hard so that he can accomplish his dream of having his own, self-sustaining farm, enabling him to have greater financial stability so that he can continue to ensure his family's well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and fatten

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Michael lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 32-year-old married businessman with three school-going children. He owns a spare parts shop in town. He  started the business more than five years ago, and it has been growing ever since. 

He knew Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy power windows, computer boxes and side mirrors for sale in the business. He hopes that in the next five years, he will be running a successful wholesale business dealing with spare parts, despite of the challenge of finding customers. 

He will use the income raised from the business to pay school fees for the children and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy power windows, computer boxes and side mirrors.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es: Don Juan de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de agua de coco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el parque central del lugar de donde él reside, posee mucha clientela pues un alimento muy vendible, con lo que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos,  don Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  cocos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and for 3 years has been making a living selling coconut water. His business is situated in the central park of the place where he lives. He has a lot of customers as it is a very saleable product, and with the money he makes he is able to cover some of the household costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 3 children. 

Juan is asking for a loan to buy coconuts wholesale so he can continue with his business, since this is his only source of income. By doing this he will be able to continue providing the daily necessities for the home without any restrictions.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime de 44 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en su hogar a pesar de su discapacidad no se da por vencido en salir a delante, el posee un negocio de compra y venta de chatarra como: aluminio, hierro, latas, botellas plásticas, etc. ubicado en su lugar de residencia  desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 18 y 15 años de edad ellas estudian actualmente, Jaime está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una bascula de plancha, almáganas y demás herramientas que utiliza para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Forty-four-year-old Jaime is hard-working and responsble with his household.  In spite of his disability, he does not give up on trying to get ahead.  Jaime has had a business buying and selling scrap materials, such as aluminium, iron, cans, plastic bottles and more, for four years.  He has been running this business out of his home for four years and the earnings from sales allow him to cover household costs.  Jaime owns his house, and lives there with his wife and two daughters, aged 18 and 15 years old each.  Both hs daughters are studying.  Jaime is applying for a loan in order to buy scales, sledgehammers, and other tools that he will use to continue with his business.  This is Jaime's only source of income and, with it, he will be able to continue bringing home his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy scales, sledgehammers, and other tools.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad  es madre soltera vive con sus dos  hijas de 13 y 7 años de edad en casa propia, Maria es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace  13 años se dedica a la producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: María is 41 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughters, aged 13 and 7 years old each.  María is hard-working, responsible and very enterprising.  For thirteen years she has made a living producing and selling dairy products in the local area.  María has a good customer base and she has known how to earn her customers' trust.  María offers quality products at good prices.  María has decided to invest in looking after her cattle, as her business depends on them.  For this María has applied for a loan in order to buy vitamins and feed for the cattle.  With this she can continue to give her daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for cattle.

loans.name: Modesto Alberto

texts.es: Modesto de 50 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, él Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito para estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Modesto is 50 years old and makes a living growing corn.  This work allows him to earn a living and take home his daily bread.  Modesto does this work every year, and it is the only job he knows.  He is hard-working, decent, and responsible.  In spite of his humble living conditions, Modesto does not tire of working and of trying to give his family the best he can.  Modesto is a fighter.  He is always looking after his family.  He lives with his wife and children in the house that they own.  Modesto has decided to come for a loan in order to to be prepared and buy the main farming supplies, such as manure, plague treatments, and seeds.   Modesto hopes to have good results as he has no other source of income.  Modesto trusts in God that he will have an abundant harvest, which will allow him to continue to take home a living.

loans.use: to buy manure, plague treatments, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Ruben Idelfonso

texts.es: Ruben de 65 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 24 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él se dedica a la venta y cultivo de café desde hace 45 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ya tiene clientela establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Ruben  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, abonos, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruben is 65 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 24-year-old son who is currently studying. Ruben has been growing and selling coffee for 45 years. He sells his produce in the different markets near his house and he has an established clientele who prefer him because of the quality of his coffee and his good prices. 

Ruben is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, manure etc. so he can continue growing his crops, since this is his only source of income. By doing this he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, manure etc.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. She is doing a business of ‘waan’ manufacturing, which is a thread-like material used to make a bedstead of wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and is famous in providing good quality material in her community. 

Azra operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it together for the sake of their family. She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members, and due to her earnings, she is better able to manage her household more efficiently. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. Azra has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales. She dreams to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make ‘waan’ (a thread-like material used to make a bedstead) with fresh quality thread.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 37-year-old woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. She has no kids; she received check-ups from many specialists in vain.

The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband owns a small tailoring shop. Now he wants to expand his shop and wants to hire a new worker so that he could take more orders for sewing cloth. He has been expanding his shop, and hired a newcomer as well, but he does not have an extra Juki machine for him.

Therefore, Zahida requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy a new machine to enhance his tailoring shop.

Zahida will treat herself to a specialist so that she could bear a baby boy; she hopes that God will bless her with a kid.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a Juki machine for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.en:
Mathieu, aged 40, is married to a farmer and has five children, four of whom go to school. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. With profits from his farming, Mathieu wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Shafagat

texts.en:
Shafagat is married. She lives with her husband and two children in Yaglivend village and they are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city. Her age is 41, her husband’s age is 45, and her children’s ages are 18 and 16. Shafagat’s husband, Mahir, is a shoemaker. Her son, Sefaqet, is a student. He studies at a technical school and her daughter goes to 10 class. When her daughter doesn’t have a lesson, she helps her mother with her poultry business.

Shafagat has poultry. She maintains a few hens, cocks, and chickens. She earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular neighborhood customers. 

Today, the number of poultry is increasing and Shafagat applied to Kiva partner, Komak Credit Union, for a loan in the amount of AZN 2,000. With this loan, she will build a hen-coop, buy some poultry, and increase her business. After she increases her business, the number of clients will increase and monthly income will be better.

Shafagat is thankful to the Komak Credit Union organization for their aid. In the future, she wants to have a poultry enterprise and to give her son a high education.

loans.use: to build hen-coop.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is 53 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband is a labor worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members. For the last six years, she has been manufacturing waan, which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors and is famous in providing good quality waan to her community. With the income, she is able to manage the needs of her family members. 

Hafeezan is requesting a loan for 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a good quality machine to make waan with fresh quality thread. With the loan, she will increase her sales. She is running her own business confidently and supporting her family. She wants to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to make waan with fresh quality thread.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, a 27-year-old married woman, has been conducting a hand-embroidery business for the past seven years. Her husband works with her. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Shahida wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of Rs 30,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing customer demand. With a good credit repayment record, this will be her third loan cycle.  Shahida wishes to use her profits for her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is a private entrepreneur from the Zuygaghbyur village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and three small children (6, 5, and 4 years old). To meet the needs of his family Edik runs a car maintenance service, particularly wheel vulcanization. He is the only breadwinner of the family. 

Edik needs to make some investments in his small business in order for it to function more effectively and to be compatible. He needs a loan of USD 2500 to purchase equipment for the car maintenance service area as well as to expand the building a little bit. This will help him to meet the demand for the service area as well as to develop his business in a sustainable way. Edik and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful for helping them maintain and develop their business

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the car maintenance service as well as to expand the building a little bit.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary bananas and sugar cane growing region. He has 1 child. He has been doing this work for 5 years. His primary income sources are eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business. His biggest challenge is a low demand market. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyamotika.'

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Mark replied that it would,  "Improve their lives."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mark owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle but he does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi aged 77 years, is widowed and has been blessed with ten children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a meat goat business, selling goats to local customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase seven goats to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a 57-year-old mother of a 22-year-old, will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. With profits from her farming, Christine wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 45 years old; he is married, and lives with his wife and 11-year-old son in the village of Sveri. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business and sells the harvested cereal crops which are grown on their own piece of land.  The income from the activity is seasonal, and in order to generate a monthly income, Aleksandre is requesting a loan to purchase a milk cow and two calves.

His loan request was approved within the frame of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

After purchasing the livestock, Aleksandre will keep them in a shed located in his yard. His wife will produce dairy products with the received milk, and sell them from their house.

The calves will be raised, and after several months they will be sold for a good price. The new initiative will generate income and Aleksandre will be able to improve the standard of living for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and two calves

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a father of four children between the ages of 6 and 14. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en:
Telesphore is 40 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been practicing this business of farming for the past seven years. 

He has requested a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production. With the profits from his farming, Telesphore wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has four children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler, and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. Currently, she resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 50 years old. He is married and has six children, and they all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno owns a food stall business.  Neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge: fluctuation in numbers of clients, which potentially leads to losses because of perishable goods.  In addition, she sells charcoal to supplement her income.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Juvens

texts.en:
Juvens is 29 years old. He is married with two children. He has been working as a farmer for the past six years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, and to support labor costs during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, and to support labor costs during the maize production

loans.name: Nanzugu

texts.en:
Nanzugu operates a clothes selling business. She sells to her neighbors, town dwellers, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan also helped her to buy more stock for sale.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nazugu

texts.en:
Nazugu has owned a kiosk (small shop) business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods to sell at her kiosk, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking fat. She appreciates the support of her previous loan. She dreams of expanding to a big shop, in future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods to sell, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking fat

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has three children, one in school and two adults. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water.
 
Halima has operated a cafe business, making comestibles like rice, tea, beans, and chapati ( flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods for the business, including maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods for the business, including maize flour, wheat flour, and rice

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo  y sus dos  hijas de 29 y 27 años de edad ellas estudian actualmente en la universidad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, él negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa por mayor, tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Teresa, 61, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters, 29 and 27. They are currently studying in the university. Teresa makes her living selling clothing - she has been doing this business for many years and this has given her a lot of experience that enables her to obtain better income. The business is located in her place of residence. She has made many customers; well people know that everything is of quality, at accessible prices and with unmatched service – she is always at the beck and call of the customers.

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of a new investment; she has good payment references and a faultless moral composition. She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time she hopes that this will bring about economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en:
Narcisse is 45 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of seven and eleven years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 25 years old. He is married and has one child. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 46 years old. He is married and has five children, aged between 2 and 16. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 37 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Muhamed has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells items like sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand his business, Muhamed has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread to sell, and will help Muhamed to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Muhamed hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Muhamed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhamed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house, which has no electricity or piped water. 

She has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major business challenge of competition from other food stall operators. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice, for resale. She dreams of expanding her business, to earn more income in the future and support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice, for resale.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's Group was inaugurated on September 12, 2011. It is composed of four women who run revenue-generating businesses with the goal of increasing their financial capacity. The women have all been living in the same neighborhood. Their main work involves small-scale commerce (i.e., cosmetics, underwear, second-hand clothing, and fish).

Janet (standing at the far right in the photograph) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children (one girl and one boy). Janet has nine years of experience selling cosmetics. She purchases her products from the wholesale market and sells to customers in the community.

She intends to take this loan of GHS 1,500 to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of cosmetics products to resell to customers. 

The profits from her business will enable her to help out her husband in covering family-related expenses.

Janet's Group needs a total amount of GHS 4,000 to buy enough goods to resell to customers.

loans.use: by purchasing large quantities cosmetics products to resell to customers.

loans.name: Laureen

texts.en:
Laureen is a married woman with one young child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her major monthly expense are rental bills.

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Laureen is requesting 80,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 30 years old. He has been farming for the past 14 years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Banakane 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BANAKANE 3 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Ebelou
assise en première  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 46;000 Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group "BANAKANE 3" are all married women, who average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their market garden work as the rainy seasons ends. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Ms. Ebelou, who is sitting first from the left in the photo.  With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Bandiagara and Mopti.

At the end of the planting season, she plans on making a profit of 46,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to help her husband in covering family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is from a rural area located in Kampong Thom Province’s Stoung District where crop farming is the common way to make a living. She is married and is the 48-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. To feed her household, she earns a living through raising pigs and supplements the income by selling Khmer Noodles in the village. She is able to earn up to US$12 per day from these businesses. She has been in this line of work for 28 years and she can manage to save only US$6 each day for future needs.
 
Vorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is requesting a loan to cover her son’s university for four years, faculty of English Literature. Vorn hopes that her son will have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to cover her son’s university costs for four years

loans.name: Subhashree Group

texts.en:
Rashmita is the Leader of a group that hails from Muniguda in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 25 years of age.  The member standing second from the right with raised hand is Rashmita. 

Rashmita has been managing a business of leaf plate making and selling in her locality. Her husband is doing a business of selling of utensils (made from aluminum), moving from market to market. During 2010 Rashmita along with other three members from her village formed a group and took out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expansion of their existing businesses. 

At the time of accessing their first loan, Rashmita was earning the sum of Rs.3,000 per month. Thereafter her income grew rapidly, commensurate with her business turnover. Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she accessed a second loan. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her shop significantly. 

At present her monthly income is Rs.5,000 but still it is not sufficient to cater for the needs of her family. After learning business procedure and knowledge, she wants to increase her business size. Now she wants a loan to purchase leaf plates as well as aluminium utensils. In future she wants to establish an ornament shop at Muniguda Market. 
 
The other three members, Rebati, Tamala and Sainta, have a grocery shop, a salon and leaf plates businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase leaf plates and aluminum utensils

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es: Yanina, de 29 años vive en compañía de su esposo Oswaldo. Ambos tienen 2 pequeñas hijas a las que cuidan con mucho amor y cariño en la casa que alquila desde hace 5 años. Yanina se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa. Su trabajo consiste en traer ropa variada de damas, caballeros y niños desde la ciudad a su pueblo natal, donde tiene buenos clientes. Su principal ventaja, es que ella deja a crédito sus prendas, que son pagadas posteriormente. Según comenta tiene clientes de confianza, por lo que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar; además de sentirse una mujer independiente y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por ello para más adelante desea ahorrar lo suficiente, para poner una tienda surtida y equipada. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Yanina; invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de ropa al por mayor para abastecer el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yanina is 29 years old and lives with her husband, Oswaldo. They have 2 young daughters who they look after with lots of love and care in the home that they have rented for the last 5 years. 

Yanina buys and sells clothes. Her work consists of bringing in a variety of women's, men's and children's clothes from the city to her hometown where she has some good customers.  The biggest advantage she offers is to buy on credit and pay for the items later. She says that she has trustworthy clients and so makes regular profit which allows her to help her husband with the household costs as well as feel independent and have a great desire to move on in life.

In the future she would like to save enough to have a well stocked and equipped shop. This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial help that she receives to keep going and promises to pay back her installments on time. 

Yanina will invest 300 Peruvian soles on purchasing clothes in bulk to fulfill her customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en:
Cesarie is 47 years old. She is married, with six children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her crop production. 

With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in, the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Group

texts.en:
Kuni is a 46-year-old lady who lives in a small town named Muniguda of Rayagada District, Odisha, India. She is the group leader of a four-member group. Her family is comprised of four members, her husband and two sons of 22 and 26 years. The member standing second from right with raised hand is the featured member. At present she has a rice and leaf plates business in her locality. She purchases rice and leaf plates in bulk and sells them in the market. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

In the year 2008 she, along with three other members of her village formed a group and for the first time, they took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the growth of their existing business. Kuni’s husband is doing grocery trading, moving from market to market around nearby villages. At present her family income is about Rs.9,000 per month which is not sufficient to maintain the family. One remarkable thing is that Kuni’s earning are more than her husband's.

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, Kuni wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a bulk quantity of rice and leaf plates and store them to sell in the market during festive occasions.  She has a dream to have a rice mill of her own.

The other three members named Bijaya, Jhunubala and Kama have leaf plates businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice and leaf plates

loans.name: Maa Ghatagan Tarini Group

texts.en:
Padmabati, aged about 46 years, is the group leader of a four-member group from Muniguda town situated in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is running a grocery shop and a tailoring shop. Her family is comprised of four members, her husband, and two sons aged 21 and 25. The member standing second from right with raised hand is Padmabati. Her husband owns an Auto Rickshaw and running from the Railway Station/Bus Station to nearby villages to earn his livelihood. Padmabati is a very active lady who wants   some extra income out of her own efforts.

Padmabati along with three other members of her village formed a group and it is the fifth time she will take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses.  At present her family income is about Rs.8,500 per month which is not sufficient to manage her family and to keep pace with present-day society. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will add some grocery items like rice, pulses (lentils), wheat, sugar, tea, etc. to her shop. She has a dream to expand her business and wants to be a wholesaler of grocery items in her small town by maintaining varieties of items.

The other three members are Saraswati, Bhagyalaxmi and Bijayalaxmi,doing fast food, a rice mill and a grocery shop respectively.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pulses (lentils), wheat, sugar, tea, salt, potatoes, onions, soap, washing powder, etc. for grocery shop

loans.name: Banakane 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BANAKANE 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  55 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.

The past loan was indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is essentially onions, as is the case with Ms. Ourgatou, who is standing first from the left in the photo.  With her loan, she intends to purchase some seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Bandiagara and Mopti.

At the end of the planting season, she plans on making a profit of 44,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to help her husband in covering family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married, with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

Bridget has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, vaseline, and other cosmetics. 

She works from home seven days out of every week and she sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. Bridget is aspiring to own a bridal salon and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, vaseline, and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Sandhyarani, aged 46, is the leader of a group that hails from Hata Muniguda of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband, having one son and one daughter aged 05 and 09 respectively. The member standing  second from left  with raised hand is Sandhyarani. 

Sandhyarani is running a clothing store with the support of her husband in her locality.  In 2009, Sandhyarani along with four other members of her village formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing business. This is her fifth cycle loan. 
 
At the time of accessing her first loan, Sandhyarani's sales were not sufficient to meet her daily requirements. Out of their small income they were maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her clothing store significantly. At present her monthly income is about Rs.8,000. She wants to take a further loan to expand her present clothing store.  She has a desire to open a shoe store adjacent to her clothing store so that whenever her previous customers come to purchase clothes they will purchase shoes also, as it a complementary product.

The other four members named Tanaya, Sudeshna, Bishnupriya and Joshna have grocery shops.

loans.use: to purchase ready-made clothes and sarees

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her husband and mother-in-law. Over past two years, Lilit has been involved in retailing cosmetics. Lilit purchases cosmetics from Yerevan town's markets, and resells them in her town. She gathers income, which is very important for helping her husband to sustain the family. Due to her hard work, Lilit currently has a big number of customers. She works hard to meet their needs and provide good-quality products to them.

Now, for being able to purchase a new stock of perfumes and sell them to customers, Lilit needs financial support. She has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important, to enable Lilit to meet her customers' needs and to earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
Sandhya is the leader of a group that hails from Sergad village of Norla block of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 27 years of age having two sons aged 9 and 5 years.  The member standing second from right with raised hand is Sandhya. 

Sandhya sells fish as her business in her locality. Her husband was helping her in this business. In the year 2010, Sandhya along with three other members of her village formed a group and took out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the expansion of their existing business. 

At the time of accessing that first loan she was earning a sum of Rs.3,000 per month. Thereafter, her income grew rapidly, commensurate with her business turnover. Out of their small income they are maintaining their family in a low profile. To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income she accessed a second loan. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her business significantly. At present her monthly income is Rs.5,000 from her fish business which is still not sufficient to cater for the needs of her family. She has a dream to have fish wholesale business after getting a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

The other three members named Baidehi, Basumati and China are doing seasonal business, a grocery shop and a fish business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja tiene 43 años  de edad es madre de tres hijos, ella vive en Punata una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba, vive junto a su esposo con quien trabaja todos los días.
Maruja se dedica a la producción de leche, ella cuenta con diez cabezas de ganado sacando una producción diaria de 120 litros diarios y de  los cuales realiza quesillos para poder vender en el Mercado de nuestra ciudad todos los días y de la misma manera ella vende mote. Maruja es una mujer trabajadora ya que cuando su esposo se fue a buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos a la Argentina, ella se dedicó al trabajo todos los días y empezó ella con tres vacas y ahora cuenta con diez.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya aumentar la producción de leche ya que ahora tiene solo cinco vacas con las cuales ella quiere seguir saliendo adelante porque necesita trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos porque ella quiere que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y poder hacer una carrera ya que Maruja no pudo terminar la escuela porque desde muy niña trabajaba con sus padres en el campo en la agricultura y en la producción de leche, ella es muy trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Maruja is 43 years old and is a mother to three children. She lives in Punata, a province of Cochabamba city. She lives with her husband who works every day. Maruja has 10 livestock who produce milk, generating 120 litres per day. From this, she makes cheese which she sells in her town's market every day. She also sells wheat there. Maruja is a hard-working woman so when her husband left to seek a better future for their children in Argentina, she worked everyday. She started with three cows and ended up with 10. 

She is requesting this loan to buy soybean hulls to increase the milk production because she currently only has five cows. She wants to keep moving forward because she needs to work to help her children because she wants them to finish school and be able to do degrees as she couldn't finish school because she had to work with her parents in the fields producing milk. She is very hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy soybean hulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels and sell greater quantities of plates and utensils.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su nieta de 12 años de edad, como todo buen comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. José  tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José has a shop where he sells everyday items like beans, milk, eggs and bread among other things. He has had his business for many years and therefore has lots of selling experience which allows him to make better profits. It is situated near where he lives in a very busy area. He has made a lot of regular customers as he has a well-stocked shop. People prefer his shop and keep him ahead of his competition because he always has the quality products that they need at accessible prices with an unbeatable service attentive to his customers. 

He lives in his own house with his wife and their 12 year old grand-daughter. Like all good salesmen he wants to grow his business and invest more but he needs capital for that. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to allow him to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks etc. José has a good track record for paying back, ensures that he will pay back what he owes and believes that it will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks etc.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Don Eduardo de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de queso, quesillo, cremas, etc. en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos en su hogar, don Eduardo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposa.
texts.en: Eduardo, 62, lives in his own house with his wife. He makes a living selling cheese, fresh cheese, cream, etc., in the market located close to his home. He manages to cover some household expenses with the money he earns from sales. Eduardo is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise so he can better serve his customers, obtain better profits, and have a higher quality of life along with his wife.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cheese, fresh cheese, cream, etc.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with seven children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees for her schooling children.

She operates a stall selliing grocery vegetables.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the business challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana vive en casa propia con su hijo, su nieta y su madre,  ella tiene un negocio de venta de diferentes artículos como: ropa, peluches, zapatos, etc. desde hace varios años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Roxana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor  y poder surtir su negocio, así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in her own house with her daughter, grand-daughter and mother. She has had a business for several years selling different articles such as: clothes, cuddly toys, shoes etc. It is located near her house. With the profits, she is able to cover some household costs. 

Roxana is requesting a loan to be able to buy more stock at wholesale and be able to restock her shop to gain more profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stock at wholesale such as: clothes, cuddly toys, shoes etc

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 53 años, está casada con Víctor, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Teofila se dedica a la siembra de papa. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Pero tambien le gusta cuidar a su ganado vacuno, lo que engorda y después vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Desde adolescente Teofila, comenzó a apoyar a sus padres en el cuidado y mejora de sus cultivos, y hasta ahora se siente feliz de poder pasar sus días en el campo. Ahora, quiere seguir mejorando la calidad de sus productos, con ello asegura podrá vender a mayor precio sus cosechas y así mejorar sus ingresos.Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teofila, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en sus diferentes  sembríos de tubérculos.
texts.en:
Teofila is 53 years old and is married to Víctor. They have 6 children but only 3 live with them in their home, which they own. 

Teofila sows potatoes. She has been working in agriculture for twenty years. She also enjoys looking after her herd of cows. She fattens them up and then sells them at market in the centre of Tarma city. 

When she was an adolescent, she started helping her parents to care for and improve their crops and she still enjoys spending her days in the field. 

She now wants to improve the quality of her products so that she can sell her harvests at a higher price and improve her income. This is her sixth loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial help as it will help her develop her business. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual in paying it back.

Teofila will invest 1000 Peruvian soles in buying organic compost which she will scatter in different potato fields.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and oranges

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is 33 years old. He is married and has four children; they all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.

Wilfrida has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer). She has run this business for one year. 

At present, Wilfrida needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu. She will invest the funds in the addition of float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to add float (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa money transfer business.

loans.name: Shahlojon

texts.ru: Шахлочон родилась в 1985 года. Она пережила трудный этап своей жизни. Муж у нее всегда пил и не зарабатывал на жизнь. Шахлочон имеет 2 детей, Шахноза и Шукрона. Шахлочон была вынуждена, разводиться с мужем. Она всегда считала, что детей надо растить в нормальной психологической атмосфере. Она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги. Шахлочон данное время справляется с бизнесом одна. Она является одной из опытных портних и имеет своих клиентов. Она постепенно улучшает условию проживания. Шахлочон собирается отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shahlojon was born in 1985.  She endured a difficult time in her life; her husband always drank and didn't work.  Shahlojon has two children, Shahnoza and Shukrona.  Shahlojon had to divorce her husband - she always thought that her children should grow up in a normal psychological atmosphere.  In order to earn money, she started her own business sewing women's clothing.  Shahlojon has been establishing her business by herself - she is one of the most experienced seamstresses and has her own clients.  She is gradually improving her living conditions, and is making plans to repair her house.  She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS in order to buy building materials like cement, wood, etc.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Chiphenyo

texts.en:
Chiphenyo is a married woman who has three kids. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling foodstuffs from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Fatuma
