His mother runs a grocery store near his house and his father is a sentry at a high school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some renovation. So he is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will be able to renovate his house, creating a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 60-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband owns a small canteen. He sell variety of food products in the canteen that includes ice cream, candies, chips, tea and biscuits.

Presently, he needs to purchase products to sell as his stock is finished. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore Nasreen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will purchase ice cream, candies, chips, tea and biscuits to sell. This will help him to continue his business. Nasreen is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, candies, chips, tea and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace varios años,  vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y dos nietos, ella comercializa su mercadería por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña María está solicitando un crédito para la compra de lazos de colores para poder seguir con la elaboración de la hamacas y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Mónica has been making and selling hammocks for some years. She lives in her own house with her husband, her daughter, and two grandchildren. She sells her goods in the various markets that are close to her home. She is able to cover some of the household expenses with what she makes from her sales and with the help of her husband and daughter. María is requesting a loan to buy colored yarn to be able to keep buying the hammocks and make better profits so that she can give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy colored yarn.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona bastante alejada, donde la totalidad de sus integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales. Son de una ciudad aun en desarrollo y en vía de crecimiento.
Claudia es parte de este grupo y se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como gallinas y cerdos, y comenta que aunque es un trabajo duro, lo hace para ayudar a su familia. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y así poder seguir criándolos para venderlos.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" communal bank was created through the joining together of several neighbors from the town of Santaní, am area relatively far away, where most of its members makes their living in agricultural activities. It is a city that is still under development and is growing. 

Claudia forms part of this group and makes her living rearing and selling farm yard animals such as chicken and pigs. She comments that although it is a hard job, she does it to help her family. She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of animal feed for her animals in order to continue rearing them for their subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: La Luz De Villa Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo “LA LUZ DE VILLASOL” es un grupo recién formado está integrado  por 7 socios quienes están emprendiendo su primer ciclo. Uno de los socios más entusiastas es el  Sr. Optaciano de 47 años que ha sido elegido el presidente del grupo como tal desea trabajar con esmero. El Sr. Optaciano es confeccionista de calzado hace 28 años se dedica a este rubro trabaja junto a su esposa que se encarga de comercializar los calzados que el confecciona, ambos se sienten agradecidos porque su trabajo les ha permitido brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación.  El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como cueros, pegamentos y suelas, en el futuro le gustaría ampliar el taller que tiene en su casa  para poder producir en cantidades mayores. El grupo está agradecido a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo que cada uno recibirá.
El Sr. Optaciano es el segundo de la izquierda viste casaca color ploma.
* 4 socios se tomaron la foto en la oficina y la foto adjunta se tomo en su lugar de trabajo(mercado)allí aparecen el Sr. optaciano y la Srta. Jackeline
texts.en:
La Luz de Villasol is a recently formed group made up of seven members who are starting their first loan cycle.

One of the most enthusiastic members is Optaciano, 47.  He was elected president of the group and as such he wants to work carefully.  Optaciano is a cobbler who has earned a living making footwear for 28 years.  He works with his wife, who's responsible for selling the shoes he makes.  Both of them are grateful because their work has allowed them to give their children a good education.

Optaciano will invest the requested loan in supplies such as leather, glue, and soles.  In the future he would like to expand the shop he has in his home so he can produce larger quantities.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan each one will receive.

Optaciano is the second one on the left, wearing a gray jacket.

Four borrowers took a photo in the office, and the adjacent photo was taken in the place of work (a market). In this adjacent photo appear Optaciano and Jackeline.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 58 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of nine children. She belongs to a poor family. She has a large family,  and her husband's income is inadequate to meet the family's needs. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

From the past many days his rickshaw has not worked properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Zubaida is so much thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Talat's Group

texts.en:
Talat, who is 42 years old, is the leader of this borrower group. 

She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a welder by profession. He is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs to purchase some welding equipment. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He doesn't have enough funds to purchase the things he needs. 

Therefore his wife Talat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will be purchasing some important welding equipment, including a welding machine, wire brush, and welding holder. 

Talat is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine, wire brush, and welding holder for her husband

loans.name: Kenyo Alberto

texts.es: Kenyo vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es trabajar para una entidad pública en el área de administración. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para su educación para la matricula de su curso de especilizacion, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Kenyo lives in the city of Pilcopata, which is in the Kosñipata district of Paucartambo in Peru's Cusco department.  His main job is working in the administration department of a public company.  He is currently seeking a loan for his personal use: to pay for his education and his enrollment fees in a specialization course. He is grateful for the loan, which means a lot to him, and guarantees that he will repay his monthly installments responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for his enrollment fees in a specialization course

loans.name: Edson

texts.es: Edson, tiene 30 años, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos porque espera consolidarse económicamente para formar su propia familia, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres junto a su abuela y sus 2 hermanos. Edson trabaja en la venta de productos alimenticios. Recibe su mercadería mensualmente que es enviada desde otra ciudad en donde tiene un familiar que le ayuda en la elección de los suplementos. El sistema de ventas es crediticio y el cobro lo hace de manera  diaria, semanal o mensual previo acuerdo con su comprador. Vende directamente entre sus familiares, amigos, vecinos y compañeros de trabajo. Realiza ésta actividad casi 05 años en sus ratos libres o por lo general los fines de semana, ya que durante el día trabaja como diseñador gráfico en un local de la ciudad. Por lo pronto, le gusta mucho ambas actividades que realiza, aunque asegura que al principio le fue difícil trabajar en la venta de suplementos alimenticios ya que tenía que enfrentar los comentarios negativos y machistas de las personas que le decían que ese es un trabajo femenino, sin embargo, ahora realiza su labor de manera óptima y sus ingresos se han incrementado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de mercadería conformada por suplementos alimenticios de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Edson, 30, is single with no children yet because he’s waiting to become economically secure before forming his own family.  He currently lives in his parents’ house with his grandmother and two siblings.  

Edson works selling nutritional supplements.  His merchandise is sent to him monthly from another city where he has a family member that helps him with the selection of the supplements.  He sells on credit and collects daily, weekly or monthly according to prior agreements with customers.  He sells directly among family members, friends, neighbors and co-workers.  He’s been in business almost five years in his free time or on weekends in general for during the week he’s employed as a graphic designer in a local firm.

For now, he likes the two activities he does very much although he says that selling the nutritional supplements was difficult at first because he had to face negative, misogynist comments from people who held that this was ‘women’s work.’  Nevertheless, he’s now working optimally and his income has increased.

On this occasion he’s asking for 3,000 soles and is grateful to all those who make his loan possible so he can continue towards his goals.  On the other hand, he’s very committed to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested amount to by a lot of merchandise consisting of several brands of nutritional supplements.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es: Gudelia, de 36 años, es una madre responsable. Vive desde hace 3 años en casa de su hermana, junto a sus 4 hijos pequeños. Ella posee pocos terrenos agrícolas, los que tiene fueron heredados de parte de su madre, ahí siembra habas, papa, cebada en pocas cantidades, a veces los alimentos los utiliza para consumo propio y cuando el precio está muy alto los comercializa a la ciudad de Jauja, pero según cuenta, en días donde no tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos, los dedica a trabajar en otros terrenos agrícolas. Por está razón su principal actividad económica se centra en el cuidado de animales como cerdos, ovejas y toros, los cuales compra para luego venderlos a un mayor precio entre los carniceros que siempre llegan a su casa, ya que conocen del oficio de Gudelia, ahora por falta de capital no tiene muchos animales que engordar, espera poder trabajar con su asociación y poco a poco adquirir la cantidad que requiere para obtener más ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que obtuvo. Gudelia, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: 36 year old Gudelia is a responsible mother. She has lived in her sister's house for 3 years along with her 4 little-ones. She has a little agricultural land that she inherited from her mother and she grows small quantities of beans, potatoes, and barley. Sometimes she uses these crops for her own food and, when the prices are very high, she sells them in the city of Juaja. But, as she tells us, on days when she doesn't have to tend her crops, she works for other farmers. For this reason, her main economic activity is raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and bulls, which she buys in order to later sell them at a higher price to the butchers who come to her house because they know her trade. At the moment, because of a lack of capital, she doesn't have many animals to fatten. She hopes to be able to work with her loan group and, little by little, to get the quantity of animals she needs to make better profits. This is her third loan from KIVA and she is grateful for the opportunity to get ahead that it offers. She will grow her business with the loan that she gets. Gudelia will invest the $725 in buying a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida, de 30 años es una mujer sencilla, vive en compañía de su esposo Flavio con quien tiene 3 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que alquila hace 5 años. Mientras que su esposo trabaja cortando leña para su venta, ella se dedica a la ganadería, posee cerdos, ovejas y vacas. Su trabajo consiste en ensebar a los animales para venderlos a un mayor precio, mientras que en las vacas, las utiliza para extraer leche y negociar todos los días con los lecheros de la zona. Durante las mañanas cuida de sus animales, ya por la tarde se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, maíz y habas, en terrenos alquilados y otros en asociación, pues su lema es “trabajar sin parar”. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Zaida, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de más animales entre cerdos y ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Zaida, 30, is an unassuming woman who lives with her husband Flavio, with whom she has 3 children.  She cares for her children in a home that the family has rented for 5 years.  While her husband works cutting firewood to sell, she raises livestock.  She has pigs, sheep and cows.  Her work consists of fattening the animals in order to sell them at a better price. She uses the cows for milk, which she sells every day to the milkmen in the zone. In the morning she cares for her animals, and in the afternoon she goes out to her fields of potato, corn, and beans. These are planted in rented fields and in others from the Association, since her motto is "work without ceasing."

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She is thankful for the opportunity to make progress, and she promises to be punctual in her payments. Zaida will invest this loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of more animals, including pigs and sheep, to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy pigs and sheep to increase her stock

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Elena está conformado por mujeres luchadoras que trabajan día a día para poder tener sus propios ingresos
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felia, que se dedica exclusivamente a la artesanía, ya que ella elabora colchas, frazadas, hamacas. Ella a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total. Comenta también que además de sus artesanías ha añadido la venta de comestibles, y así está mejorando su economía poco a poco.
La Sra. Felia  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para la venta de sus alimentos, como ser carne, verduras, arroz, fideo y demás, y también de materiales para sus artesanías.
Hay dos personas mas en la foto, ya que ellas dos en este ciclo no retiran crédito, pero si integran el grupo y firman.
texts.en:
The Santa Elena communal bank consists of hard-working women who work day after day to be able to have their own incomes. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Felia, who works exclusively in handicrafts, since she makes bedspreads, blankets, and hammocks. Through her effort, continual work, and application of the life behaviors of a successful woman, she is improving her situation of poverty, but she is equally conscious that this work and the effort that she is making have to be continuous and permanent to achieve total success. She also comments that in addition to her handicrafts, she has added the sale of food, and thus she is improving her economic situation little by little. 

Señora Felia is applying for this loan to purchase supplies for her food sales, such as meat, vegetables, rice, pasta, and other items, as well as materials for her handicrafts.

There are two additional people in the photo that are not taking out credit in this cycle, but they are still members of the group and have signed forms.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food, such as meat, vegetables, rice, pasta, and other items, and also materials for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un joven de un cliente de la fundación, es una persona muy trabajadora y proviene de una familia muy humilde que está trabajando por mejorar su vida.
Él es ayudante de un enfermo, y se está esmerando por ir mejorando cada día más.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y con ello está esforzándose por un futuro mejor. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de manutención, ya que tiene muchos gastos, y quiere poder cubrirlos. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo, que le será de muy provecho.
texts.en:
Ruben is one of the foundation's young clients. He is a hardworking person had comes from a humble family that is working to improve his life.

He is working as an assistant to a sick patient and he is putting forth a lot of effort to continue improving each day.

He is studying to become a nurse and is working to have a better future. He requests this loan so that he can invest it in covering his living expenses, since he has a lot of expenses and wants to be able to pay for them. He is thankful for the help that he is receiving and knows that it will be very beneficial.

loans.use: to pay for his living expenses.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es:
La Sra Iluminada tiene  50 años y tiene un comedor en la frontera con Argentina hace más de 9 años. Comenta que su sueño es que una de sus hijas abra un comedor cerca al suyo y que puedan trabajar juntas.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha dado a su familia todo lo que necesita con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas en general, para poder surtir su negocio y poder de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Iluminada, age 50, has had an eatery on the border with Argentina for over nine years.  She says that her dream is for one of her daughters to open an eatery close to hers and that they are able to work together.

She is a very hard-working woman who has given her family everything they need with great effort and sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy beer and soft drinks.  She will do this so that she is able to stock her business.  In this way she will be able to continue giving her customers everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ludwin

texts.es: Ludwin de 24 años es un hombre responsable y trabajador. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño. Ludwin, se dedica a la reparación de calzados de cuero, además de ser la única persona de su localidad que se dedica a está actividad, por ello siempre tiene trabajo. Comenta que le va muy bien, pero que a un inicio le fue muy difícil tener clientes por lo que con paciencia pudo mejorar poco a poco sus ganancias, aún es muy joven y desea ahorrar lo necesario para poder mejorar su trabajo pues su meta es abrir un taller grande, comprar máquinas y aprender nuevas técnicas. Éste es su primer crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que obtuvo. Ludwin, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de cuero al por mayor para continuar con su labor.
texts.en:
Ludwin is 24 years old and is a responsible, hard-working man.  He lives together with his parents and siblings whom he cares for with great love and affection. Ludwin is a shoe repairman and is the only one in his area who does such work, so he is always busy. He says that although it is going very well for him now, in the beginning it was hard to get customers but with patience he was able to increase his earnings little by little.  Although he is very young he hopes to save enough to improve his business and one day open a big shop, buy machines and learn new skills.

This is his first loan with KIVA, and he appreciates the opportunity to advance that they have offered. He will begin to improve his business with the loan by investing the money in the purchase of leather at wholesale prices to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy leather at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María cliente de 23 años de edad nacida en el Cantón Sigchos a pocos metros de Latacunga de la provincia de Cotopaxi, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, es soltera, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudo culminar la secundaria, por la mala situación económica de su hogar tuvo que migrar a la ciudad es por eso que hoy en día vive en la ciudad de Latacunga barrio La Estación, trabaja como ayudante de una tienda en pleno centro, vive con la dueña, en sus ratos libres se dedica a tejer a mano, hace chalinas, bufandas, edredones y los vende siendo ésta actividad una fuente de ingresos adicionales, es muy hábil, emprendedora  y muy trabajadora, ella se traslada a lo lago de la ciudad y fuera de ella para vender sus productos y brindar seguridad a sus clientes. María acaba de perder un bebé de 5 meses de gestación por problemas en su salud, pese a esto María no se ha dado por vencida y lucha día a día por salir a delante, a la distancia vela por la seguridad y bienestar de su familia. Esta manualidad la aprendió de su madre quien desde niña sabe del arte y ha compartido de generación en generación.
María adquirió un vehículo de segunda mano, el mismo que le es muy útil para poder trasladarse de un lugar a otro, pero lamentablemente por el uso se le dañó, es por esta razón  que solicita un crédito para poder repararlo ya que es una herramienta muy necesaria para trasladarse hacia sus clientes y realizar la gestión de cobranza, además que es muy útil para llevar la mercadería que produce, por lo cual quiere en esta ocasión  agradecer a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y hogar.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old and was born in the Sigchos canton near Latacunga, which is in the Cotopaxi province in Ecuador.  She is single and thanks to the help of her parents, she was able to graduate secondary school.  Due to difficult financial circumstances, she had to move to the city.  For this reason, she currently lives in the Estación area of the city of Latacunga.

María works as an assistant in a store in the city center and lives with the store owner.  In her free time, she knits chalinas (traditional shawls), scarves, and quilts and then sells them as an additional source of income.  She is very skilled, enterprising, and hardworking.  She goes throughout the city and also outside of the city to sell her goods and give security to her customers.

María recently lost a child after 5 months of pregnancy due to health issues, but despite this María has not given up and strives every day to get ahead.  She hopes to look out for the safety and wellbeing of her family.  She learned to knit from her mother, who in turn learned it when she was young and has passed it on from generation to generation.

María obtained a second-hand car which is very useful for getting from one place to another.  Unfortunately, though, it has broken down due to being used so much.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan so she can fix her car since it is something that is very necessary for her to get to her customers and make sales.  In addition, it is very useful in that it allows her to transport the items that she makes.  

At this time, she expresses her thanks to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for allowing her to grow in her work life and her home life.

loans.use: fix her car, which she uses for work.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 2 hijas, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Ana no pudo culminar sus estudios de Secretariado que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Ana trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras y repuestos para motos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería como arroz, por saco, azucar, fideos al por mayor, atun en caja, entre otros; para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijas convertidas en profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is a 43-year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her two daughters.  She is very hardworking and enthusiastic and she puts all her effort into getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and a need to find work, Ana was not able to complete her secretarial studies.

On her own initiative, Ana works at her business selling groceries, vegetables, and car parts.  She works every day for around 10 hours and she believes it is going well for her because of her hard work and dedication.  

Ana is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise to buy merchandise such as rice, sacks, sugar, wholesale noodles, boxed tuna, among other things to stock her business.  She will keep working and applying herself to achieve her great dream of seeing her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sacks, sugar, wholesale noodles, boxed tuna, among other things

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Rina ella es casada, tiene 51 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de bocaditos, tortas entre otros, para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan como matrimonios, fiesta de cumpleaños entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azucar, mantequilla entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
La socia que aparece en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen Purificada" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member in question is Rina - she is married, is 51 years old and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business that makes sandwiches, cakes and so on for the different engagements such as weddings, birthday parties and so on. Rina has spent a long time in this business which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts every day into her company. Rina hopes to be able to continue working so that she can continue to support her family in this manner. Rina is seeking the loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter and so on. 

The other members make their living working in a bookstore business, a business selling clothes, a grocery store business, and a taxi service business. Rina is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this method and she pledges to meet the repayments within the set time frame.

The borrower that appears in the inserted photo asked permission to come late to the meeting where we took the photo because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, butter and more.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se formó con la unión de 21 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por salir adelante, hoy gracias a su esfuerzo ya están en el tercer ciclo del programa de comités.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella con perseverancia hasta hoy día esta con su negocio propio que es el de una despensa situada en su casa, está ayudando a su familia y dándoles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
La Sra. Felicia solicita este crédito para la compra de panificados, frutas, leche, productos a granel y demás para la venta en su despensa, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir con sus clientes, a la vez que ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group was formed by 21 women, all of them friends and neighbors in the city of Carapeguá.  Each woman is the head of her household and they are striving for a better way of life.  Thanks to their efforts, they are now in the third cycle of the program committee. 
One of the members is Felicia.  Due to her continued effort and hard work, and having what it takes to be a successful woman, she finds her situation of poverty improving.  However, she is conscious of the fact that she must keep working hard in order to achieve long-lasting success, so that she can provide her family with a better standard of living.  Her perseverance has meant that today she has her own business, a store located in her own house, which she knows is helping her family and ensuring that they are not deprived of anything.
Felicia needs this loan to buy breads, fruits, milk, and other bulk products for selling, which will help her improve her profits and satisfy her customers, at the same time as helping her family.

loans.use: to buy breads, fruits, milk, and other bulk products

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus tres hijos quienes trabajan y ayudan en el hogar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace 4 años, comercializa su mercadería por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, doña María esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, lazos y lanas de colores para poder seguir con la elaboración de la hamacas y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria is 46, lives at her own house with her mother and three children that work and help at home, she has worked making and selling hammocks for 4 years, she offers her merchandise in the different neighborhoods that are near her residence, with what she makes from her sales she is able to cover home expenses, Maria is requesting a loan to buy threads, cords and wool of different colors to be able to continue making hammocks and have better profits to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy threads, cord  and wool of different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do motorcycle taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Baños  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Baños está formado por 14 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Baños en Cuenca, lugar que tiene mucha vegetación, su suelo emana aguas termales que son el origen de varios balnearios, su gastronomía es típica y muy variada. Su gente aun mantiene viva su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  Señora. Teresa, está realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras, del grupo de crédito Baños, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque en cada reunión se encuentra con sus amigas y compañeras con quienes comparten muy buenos momentos, al mismo tiempo que estrechan aun más sus lasos de amistad y compañerismo.
La Señora Teresa tiene 41 años de edad, está casada hace 15 años y ha concebido 2 niños de 11 y 6 años que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en un taller de tapicería que es de su propiedad, la casa en la que vive no es propia.
Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catalogo, comenzó este negocio primero ayudándole a su cuñada a vender y se dio cuenta que era una muy buena manera de obtener ingresos para su hogar, ahora a este negocio le dedica 5 horas diarias y su mercadería lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.
Su crédito va a invertir para la compra de cosméticos y ropa que se encuentra en oferta para así ampliar sus ventas. 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Baños” communal bank consists of 14 women from Baños parish in Cuenca.  This is an area of lush vegetation and thermal springs that give rise to several resorts.  Its cuisine is very typical and very varied.  Its residents still keep their culture and traditions alive.

One of the group members is Teresa who is taking out her third loan alongside her friends and  Baños group companions.  She likes this way of getting loans because she meets with her friends and fellow members at each meeting to share good times while at the same time they strengthen their bonds of friendship and companionship.

Teresa is 41-years-old, married for 15 years and mother of two children who are 11 and 6 years old attending the local school.  Her husband works in an upholstery shop he owns and the house they live in is not their own.

Teresa works selling cosmetics and clothes via catalog.  She stared this at first helping her sister-in-law sell and realized it was a good way to earn household income.  Now, she spends five hours daily in the business selling her merchandise throughout the city.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetics and clothes that are on sale to expand her sales.  Her dream is to own a house.

The two small photos are of members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 48 años de edad tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años posee mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus cuatros hijos, Santiago está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pinturas, lijas, un compresor, una pulidora y demas herramientas que necesita, para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 48 year old Santiago has had a bodywork and painting workshop in his home for 8 years. He has many customers because of the quality of his work and his good prices. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with his profits. He lives in his own home with his partner and their 4 children. Santiago is requesting a loan to buy paint, a compressor, a polisher, and other tools that he needs to continue his business as this is his only source of income. This will enable him to give his family what they need without limits.

loans.use: to buy paint, sandpaper, a compressor, a polisher, and other tools that he needs.

loans.name: Falconiere

texts.es: Falconiere, de 49 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Olinda en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica desde niño es la siembra de productos de primera calidad como papa, alverja, maíz entre otros. Comenta que cuando formó su familia se independizó de sus padres eso le causó un poco de problemas por la falta de capital pero poco a poco obtuvo ganancias con paciencia y mucho trabajo. Ahora tiene terrenos propios y siembra los productos en cantidad, vendiéndolos al mercado de la ciudad a buenos precio. Desea continuar con esta negocio y ahorrar para invertir en la mejora de sus sembríos. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Falconiere, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Falconiere, age 49, is a responsible man.  He lives with his wife, Olinda, in his own house.  His work, ever since he was a boy, is growing first quality products like potatoes, peas, and corn, among others.

He states that when he formed his family, he became independent of his parents.  This caused a bit of a problem because of the lack of capital.  However, little by little, he got income with patience and a lot of work.

He now has his own land, and he grows products in quantity, selling them for a good price at the market in the city.  He wishes to continue with this business and save in order to invest in the improvement of his crops.

This is his first loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the financial support he is receiving in order to get ahead.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  Falconiere will use the 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía, tiene 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Doña Rosalía trabajó por varios años en una compañía bananera y Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de tarjetas de recargas(saldo) para celulares, también elabora y vende donas, refrescos, helados y otras golosinas. El préstamo que solicito es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de tarjetas de recargas de saldo para celulares, insumos para elaborar helados y comida como carnes, condimentos, bolsas, tutifruti, paletas, azúcar, arroz, manteca etc. y refrescos.  Con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Su objetivo es continuar con su negocio y seguir apoyando a uno de sus hijos con  la educación.
texts.en:
Doña Rosalía is 53 and lives with her common-law husband, the father of her three children, in the town of Lima, Cortes. Doña Rosalía  worked for years at a banana company and has for six years sold cards for recharging cell phone balances. She also sells soft drinks, ice cream, and other snacks, including donuts that she makes herself. 

Doña Rosalía is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras and will invest these funds in the purchase of to purchase cards for recharging cell phone balances; supplies for preparing ice cream and items such as meats, condiments, tutti fruitti, ice pops, sugar, rice, butter, soft drinks, and other goods for sale. Doña Rosalía expects that this investment will boost her sales and income. Her goal is to keep operating her business and continue providing support for the education of one of her sons.

loans.use: to purchase cards for recharging cell phone balances; supplies for preparing ice cream and foods such as meat, condiments, tutti fruitti, ice pops, sugar, rice, butter, soft drinks, and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley, de 22 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Juan, con quien tiene un hijo, al que cuida en la casa que construyeron hace un año. Desde las primeras horas del día se dedica al cultivo de diversas verduras, además de alverjas, papa. “Junto a mi esposo me dirijo a los terrenos agrícolas, estar ahí y ver crecer a mis sembríos, es mi principal gratificación”, afirma. Hace 5 años que comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente en los terrenos que heredó de sus padres, donde ahora aplica todos los conocimientos que aprendió desde niña. Afirma sin ninguna duda, que sus cosechas son compradas a buen precio en el mercado mayoristas de la ciudad, donde cada 4 meses lleva a comercializar los alimentos maduros. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera poder tener mayor producción y por ende mayores ingresos, espera que con el dinero que ahorra  lo que gana en la ganadería pueda lograra su objetivo. Este se segundo préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Shirley, invertirá los S/.2000 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: 22 year old Shirely is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Juan, with whom she has one son who they are bringing up in the house that they built a year ago. She works from the early hours of the morning growing various greens as well as peas and potatoes. "Along with my husband, I work the land. Being there and seeing my crops grow is my greatest reward", she says. 5 years ago, she began working for herself in the fields that she inherited from her parents. Now she applies all the knowledge that she's learned since she was a little girl to those fields. She says that, without doubt, her crops will be bought for a good price in the major markets in the city where she sells her produce every 4 months, when it's ready. Now she wants to improve her income in order to buy more agricultural land and have better production and greater profits. She hopes that, with the money that she saves and the income she gets from her livestock, she will reach her goal. This is her second loan from KIVA and in all this time she has shown herself to be a responsible person and committed to her loan group. She promises to be punctual in making her repayments. Shirley will invest the $725 in buying organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдужалил жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он благополучно женат и  имеет на иждивении  4 детей. Абдужалил живёт в сельской местности. Он очень любит природу и животных, особенно любит лошадей. Как трудолюбивый человек, он постоянно трудится, чтобы иметь всё необходимое для своей семьи и своих детей. Он давно решил заняться бизнесом и свой выбор он остановил на животноводстве. Он выращивает и продаёт скот. А также Абдужалил занимается дехканством, что приносит ему дополнительный доход. У него на данный момент имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает и скоро уже будет продавать. Но Абдужалил хочет и дальше расширять этот бизнес, для этого ему нужно закупить ещё несколько голов скота. Поэтому Абдужалил обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en: Abdujalil is a cheerful and positive 42 year old man.  He is happily married and has 4 dependent children.  Abdujalil lives in a rural area and loves nature and animals, especially horses.  As a hardworking man, he is constantly striving to attain all of the essentials for his family and his children.  Long ago he decided to start his own business, and he landed upon livestock.  He raises and sells cattle, and also engages in animal husbandry as a way to make extra money.  He currently owns a few head of cattle, which he is raising and will sell soon.  Abdujalil wants to further expand his business, but for this he needs to buy a few more head of cattle.  Abdujalil thus turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase livestock.  He is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their help in expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yenis Marcela

texts.es:
Yenis Marcela con 35 años de edad es ama de casa y agricultora madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven en casa uno de ellos está en la secundaria estudiando electromecánica y el menor está en la primaria por lo que ambos al salir de sus actividades colaboran con sus padres en los diferentes trabajos que se realizan en la parte de la agricultura.  Ella tiene 9 años de educación y agradece el apoyo brindado por sus padres en su juventud para con ella en todos los aspectos. Ella en compañía de su pareja el cual es agricultor se ha dedicado a esta actividad por muchos años y fue por interés propio que ella decidió aprender a trabajar la tierra. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja es propio y lo adquirió gracias a la compra que hicieron a uno de sus clientes el cual les facilito a ellos obtener un terreno para trabajar lo propio y está ubicado a 20 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando.

Ella actualmente necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas para proteger sus cultivos de café con los cuales al final de la cosecha ella planea vender el grano y obtener ingresos para re invertir en sus cultivos. 

Los planes y sueños a futuro son los de comprar más tierra para poder seguir cultivando café y ofrecer una mejor variedad como el caturra, lempira, etc. que son productos competitivos en el mercado y más atractivos para sus clientes. Para con sus hijos apoyarlos al máximo en sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse y autorrealizarce en una etapa de sus vidas.
texts.en:
Yenis Marcela, age 35, is a housewife and a farmer.  She has two children, and they live at home.  One of them is in high school studying electromechanics.  The youngest is in elementary school.  When they leave their activities both children help their parents with the different agricultural jobs that they do.

She has nine years of education.  She is grateful for the support in all aspects that her parents gave her in her youth.  She and her life partner, a farmer, have worked together in this business activity for many years.  It was through self-interest that she decided to learn to work the land.  The land that she works with her life partner is her own.  She got it thanks to a purchase they made from one of their customers.  He facilitated their getting their own land to work.  The land is located 20 minutes from her house, and they get there by walking.

She now needs financial support to buy agricultural supplies to protect her coffee crops.  At the end of the harvest she plans to sell the grain and get income to reinvest in her crops.

Her plans and dreams for the future are to buy more land in order to be able to continue growing coffee.  She plans to offer a better variety like ‘caturra’ and ‘lempira’, etc.  These are competitive products in the market, and they are the most attractive to her customers.  She plans on supporting her children’s education to the maximum so that they are able to graduate and fulfill themselves at one point in their lives.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Cesar y su pequeño hijo al que cuidan en la casa de su padres. Sus principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura con la siembra de productos de primera calidad como papa, alverja, maíz, avena entre otros. Comenta que gracias a su buen juicio en la siembra de los productos le va muy bien pues desde niña aprendió a cuidar de los alimentos. Ahora tiene terrenos propios heredados de su padre donde hace 2 años comenzó a producir por ella misma. Su principal deseo es ahorrar para comprar más terrenos agrícolas.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Olga, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Olga is a very hardworking young woman. She lives with her husband Cesar and their young son. Olga's parents care for the boy in their home while she and Cesar are working. Olga's main economic activity is farming; she grows high-quality potatoes, peas, corn, oats, and other crops.  

Olga notes that thanks to her shrewd judgment in planting, her farm is doing well. She learned to grow crops as a girl. Olga now has her own land, a plot that her father gave her and that she began working herself two years ago. Olga's chief ambition is to save money for the purchase of more farmland. This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she's receiving to improve her farm. Olga is committed to making her payments on time. She will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of organic manure to feed her plantings.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy, de 41 años, es un hombre feliz y responsable. Está casado con Jessica y tiene 2 hijos; a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Desde muy joven comenzó a dedicarse a la actividad agrícola, el principal ingreso económico de su familia. De eso hace 23 años promedio. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, alverja y maíz, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que con mucho esfuerzo y con el pasar de los años adquirió. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder limpiar la maleza de entre sus sembríos; pero lo que le disgusta son las temporadas de helada que existen producto de las lluvias, ya que pierde muchos sembríos, generándole pérdidas. Por esa razón y porque Fredy es una persona muy inteligente, se dedica también a la ganadería; criando carneros, cerdos, y cuyes, los cuales enseba y revende a un buen precio, logrando así solventar las necesidades de su familia. Le va muy bien en su negocio, por ello más adelante está pensando adquirir una estancia, donde pueda cuidar mejor a sus animales. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Fredy, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Fredy, age 41, is a happy and responsible man.  He is married to Jessica, and he has two children whom his is raising in the house he bought some years ago.  When he was very young he started farming, the main income for his family.  He has been doing this for 23 years.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, and corn.  He grows them on his own land, which he got through the years with a lot of effort.

What he likes the most about his work is being able to clear the weeds from his plants.  However, he does not like the cold spells that exist as a product of the rains.  This is because he loses a lot of plants, which leads to losses for him.

That is the reason, and because Fredy is very smart, that he also works with livestock.  He raises sheep, pigs, and guinea pigs.  He fattens them and resells them for a good price.  This way he manages to pay for the family’s necessities.  It is going very well for him in his business.  Therefore, later on he is planning on getting a farm where he will be better able to raise his animals.

This is his second loan with Kiva.  In all of this time he has shown himself to be a responsible person who is committed to his association.  He pledges to be punctual with his payments.  Fredy will use the 3,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayjamal

texts.ru: Айжамал 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Айжамал - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной  школе. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айжамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 лошадей, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айжамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Ayjamal is 37 years old, married, and is raising 5 children with her husband.  Ayjamal has a higher education and works as a teacher in the local school.  Ayjamal's work in animal husbandry has served as the major source of income for her family beginning 17 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to Ayjamal's hard work, she has 2 milk cows, 5 horses, and 30 sheep.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of increasing the number of livestock in her care, Ayjamal turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 45,000 KGS.  She will use the loan to buy heifers for breeding, and will use the income from her loan to continue to augment her herd and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida, age 31, adores her family, and her husband works very hard to ensure that everyone can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers home building services. Khalida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to improve her husband's business by allowing him to buy bamboo, nails, and iron sheets. With the profits he earns from this loan, her husband intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Khalida is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nails, and iron sheets.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Несколько лет назад умер муж Мунавара, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Ей 37 лет. Она кормилица 2  детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них. Семь  лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажей тканей на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает ткани для шитья женской одежды, так как спрос больше. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих сирот. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  14000 сомони для покупки ткани для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Она мечтает, чтобы ее дети были образованными людьми.
texts.en: Several years ago Munavar's husband died, and it was really difficult for her to cope with her family expenses.  She is 37 years old and is the foster mother of 2 children.  She is a light in the lives of these children and is their only hope.  Seven years ago she started her own business purchasing and selling fabric in the local market.  She has her own trading stall in the local market and primarily sells fabric for sewing women's clothing because the demand is greater.  She needs to update her wares for the new season and get more clients because she needs to earn more money to provide for the orphans.  She is asking for a loan of 14,000 TJS to purchase fabric for the new season.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.  It is her dream that her children become educated people.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Uzma's Group

texts.en: Uzma is 32 years old, lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the devoted mother of  two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession, but his vehicle is not working properly and he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, but lacks the funds to do this. That is why Uzma, who leads a two-person loan group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw and resuming his business. He hopes to use the profit earned as a result of this loan to buy a motor bike for his family's personal use. Uzma is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Husanara's Group

texts.en: HusanAra is a 48-year-old housewife who lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of six children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in a local market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges, but would like to offer a greater variety of items to his customers because this will help him increase his net income and savings. But due to a lack of money he finds doing this difficult. Therefore his wife HusanAra, who leads a two-person loan group, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy a variety of fruits from local growers and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit he earns, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. HusanAra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José de 26 años, estudio 6° Grado, tiene tres años de estar acompañado. Su esposa trabaja por lo menos 15 días al mes en el campo, ya sea en los cañales o la platanera.

El trabajo que realiza José, es  agricultura, lo aprendió des de la edad de diez  años con su papá, des de entonces conoce de cultivar cualquier variedad de frutal,  entonces su afán es sembrar y ver los frutos de su trabajo, se dedicó a este trabajo, por falta de oportunidades de otro trabajo, donde tiene el cultivo está a ½ kilómetro de su casa   

El préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, es para comprar 15 sacos de fertilizantes, foliares  y mano de obra para el chapeo, ya que don José no riega veneno para el monte, lo hace solo con la Cuma,  la limpia de su frutal.  Es así que quiere terminar de sacar la cosecha de 7,000 metros cuadrados de plátano, que la tiene de cuatro meses de edad, con esfuerzos a llevado la plantación hasta esa edad. 

Con el préstamo, existe más la posibilidad de que su cultivo no desmejore su follaje. Y estera cumpliendo la necesidad de  poder fertilizar  su plantación de frutal.

El  sueño de José y su familia es tener todo lo necesario para  cultivar y fertilizar, y en el futuro tener posibilidades de comprar algunas cosas más necesarias para el hogar, y que su hija viva mejor y enviarla  a la escuela,  piensas darle Estudio hasta tener una profesional esa es su visión.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, studied up to the 6th grade, and has been in a relationship for three years. His wife works in the countryside at least 15 days per month, either in the sugarcane fields or the bananas.

The work that José does is agriculture. He started learning this work from his father at ten years of age. Since then, he has learned how to cultivate any variety of fruit tree, so he is eager to plant and see the fruits of his work. He made a living from this work because of a lack of opportunities for other work, whereas his crop is ½ kilometer from his house.

The loan requested from Fundación CAMPO is to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer, foliar spray and labor for weeding. José doesn't spray poison on the mountain; he only clears the growth under his fruit trees with a machete. This is how he wants to finish harvesting 7,000 square meters of plantains, which are four months old. He has gotten the plantation to that age with effort. 

With the loan, there is a greater possibility that the foliage of his crop will remain in good condition, and he will fulfill the need to be able to fertilize his fruit tree plantation.

José's dream and that of his family is to have everything necessary to cultivate and fertilize his crops, and in the future to have to opportunity to buy some more things that are necessary for his home. He wants his daughter to have a better life and to send her to school. He intends to let her study until she becomes a professional; that is his vision.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer, foliar spray and labor for weeding

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 28 años es una madre ejemplar. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo e hijo al que cuida con mucho amor. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 5 años es la siembra de papa, alverja y demás alimentos. Cuenta que desde que conformó su familia comenzó a sembrar por su propia cuenta, de eso ya algunos años, gracias a sus padres ahora tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Espera dentro de algunos meses poder mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos pues hace poco adquirió unos terrenos propios para aumentar la cantidad de sus cosechas, ahora tiene pensado ahorrar para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Francisca, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 28 years old and is an exemplary mother. She lives in her parents' house together with her husband and her son, whom she cares for with a lot of love. For the last five years, she has made a living by planting potatoes, peas and other foods.

She says that she started to plant things on her own when she started a family a few years ago. Thanks to her parents she now has agricultural lands of her own. She hopes to be able to improve the quality of her crops within a few months, as she recently acquired some lands of her own in order to increase the quantity of her crops. At the moment she intends to save to improve the quality of her crops.

This is her first loan with Kiva. Over time she has shown herself to be a responsible person who is committed to her association. She therefore commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. Francisca will invest the 600 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en: Hafizan is an energetic 48-year-old married woman. For the last 16 years, she has been been in the business of manufacturing ‘waan’ (which is a material used in bedding). She makes various kinds of waan in different colors, and is famous for providing a good-quality product to people in her community. This is how she meets the needs of her family members. Her husband works with his wife because his income is not enough to meet the needs of his family. Hafizan has seven children, one daughter and six sons, four of whom attend school. She would like to improve her business, so she has applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to use when helping her in his free time. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to use part of the money she earns for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy, de 34 años, es una valiente madre soltera, que cuida con mucho amor de su hija de 12 años. Con la que vive en casa de sus padres.Desde muy joven afronto muchas dificultades; pues tenía que hacer frente a las responsabilidades de ser mamá. Comenzando así desde hace 12 años a sembrar papa, alverja, habas y lechuga, en sus terrenos propios; que heredó de parte de sus padres. Todas las mañanas comparte sus actividades, ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, criando a los carneros, cerdos y vacas, que posee. Alimentándolos hasta que estén ensebados, para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Asimismo prepara queso con la leche que produce las vacas, realizando de 2 a 4 moldes diarios, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 30 a S/.40 soles a la semana. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de maíz y lechuga, que dentro de un mes extraerá de la tierra. Asegurando su buena venta, pues trabajó mucho en su cuidado. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Susy, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Susy, 34, is a brave single mother that takes care of her 12 year-old daughter with much love.  From a young age she faced many difficulties because she had to confront the responsibilities of become a mom.  She started 12 years ago growing potatoes, peas, beans and lettuce on her own land that she inherited from her parents.  Every morning she divides her activities, as she works raising livestock like cattle, pork, and cows that she owns.  She feeds them until they are grown and she then sells them for a higher price.  She also makes cheese with the milk that the cows produce, she makes 2 to 4 containers every day, she earns 30 to 40 PEN per week.  She is now getting ready for corn and lettuce harvest, that she will get in a month. She will have a good sale, because she worked very hard caring for it.  This is her fifth loan with KIVA, during all this time she showed being a responsible and committed person with the association.  She promises to be punctual with the loan repayments.  Susy will invest 500 PEN in buying organic fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina ella es casada y tiene 63 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y azúcar.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de pasamaneria, hospedaje, fotocopiadoras, cabinas de internet, cerrajero, restaurante, panaderia.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “LOS PERSEVERANTES” (The ones that persevere) communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco                                                                                                                                                                                            

Alejandrina is married and 63 years old. She alternates daily activities with the business of grocery store, where Alejandrina sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks among others. She has made a living from this business for a good time. A business, which is going well, thanks to the efforts that she puts each day into her business, the member wants to be able to continue to work for to support her family.

Alejandrina requested the loan to buy goods such as rice and sugar. The other members are engaged in the business of braids, lodging, photocopiers, internet booths, locksmith, restaurant, bakery.

The members of "Los Perseverantes" are in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late in the meeting for work reasons. The person that comes up with a face covered does not belong to the village bank.

The member thanked all those who are part of this dream through Kiva and is committed to meet all the payments of in the timely manner.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 31 years old and an energetic married woman. For the last nine years, she has been doing a business of manufacturing "waan" (which is a material used in making charpoy, a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). 

She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous for providing good-quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Rukhsana is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a laborer whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. 

She is running her own business confidently and supporting her family. Rukhsana has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy another waan-making machine for her son to assist her in his free time. 

She wants to expand her business to earn better profits to provide a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making "waan"

loans.name: Sanira

texts.en:
Sanira is a first-year student at AUCA's department of software engineering. Here is her story. 

“There is a time when every high school graduates have to decide what step to take on their education further. I did not have to think much, because I have been planning on going to American University of Central Asia since I was on 9th grade at my high school. I consider AUCA as the best university in my country and in the whole Central Asia, which gives a high qualified education. There were many departments to consider though. I wanted to choose any department related to math, because I am good at it. Basically I was thinking about two departments: Economics and Software Engineering. I stopped my choice on Software Engineering. I am sure that it will be interesting for me to study at the Software Engineering department and it will be able to make contribution for the benefit of our country. Another great opportunity that AUCA gives to all its students is a loan. Taking an opportunity I am also applying for a KIVA loan, which will help me to cover my tuition.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Loradel

texts.en:
Loradel is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will use in growing her general store business by buying various groceries and food snacks that she will also sell in the school. Aside from this, Loradel has a livestock raising business as her other source of income. She hopes that her PHP 2,000 initial capital from retailing will get bigger and bigger to succeed someday. 

She is already 27 years old, got married when she was 23 and now has two school aged kids. Her husband works as a truck driver. They both work together towards fulfilling a progressive family life in their peaceful and pineapple rich village of Magleticia.

loans.use: in growing her general store business by buying various groceries and food snacks that she will also sell in the school.

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela is 30 years old and married, the mother of two children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a tailoring business, which is the only source of income for his family. He has excellent tailoring skills, and his customers appreciate his work. He is planning to purchase one more tailoring machine to cope with customers' needs efficiently and professionally. 

Nabeela, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase a machine to stitch up more dresses so he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Nabeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine.

loans.name: 12 De Abril  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril está formado por 12 mujeres quienes laboran en la en un mercado de la ciudad, tienen un puesto en donde cada día es una nueva lucha para su superación, su objetivo en común es salir en adelante y brindarles a sus familias un futuro prometedor, aun conservan su cultura y tradiciones. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene clima frió y una belleza que enamora a quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Encarnación, es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias con quienes comparte diferentes actividades dentro de este grupo, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca.
La Señora Encarnación tiene 79 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos mayoría de edad, algunos ya son casados y viven independiente, sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.
Doña Encarnación se dedica a la venta de frutas y hortalizas en su propio local,  labora desde las 7 de la mañana sin un horario de salida ya que todo depende de las ventas del día. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y hortalizas para surtir su negocio. 
Su sueño es de conservar su salud y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar prresentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'Sociedad 12 de Abril' [April 12th Association] loan group is formed by twelve women who work and have stalls in a city market where each day is a new struggle to overcome. Their common objective is to get ahead and to provide their families with a promising future, while still preserving their culture and traditions. The women live in the city of Cuenca, known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos. Since December 1999 it has been a World Heritage Site. It has a cold climate and a beauty that charms everyone who visits.

One of the members of this group is Encarnación. She is a founding member of the 'Sociedad 12 de Abril' loan group, and is very good friends with all of the group members, with whom she shares the responsibility for various group activities. She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca.

Encarnación is 79 years old. She has nine adult children from her marriage, some of whom are already married and live independently. Her unmarried children work and help her financially. She doesn't have a house of her own and rents her home. 

Encarnación makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables in her area. She works from 7 o'clock in the morning without a specific end time, as everything depends on the day's sales. She is going to invest the money from the loan in buying fruits and vegetables to stock her business. Her dream is to preserve her health and to keep growing in her business.

The small photo is of the three members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en: Shahida is a 33-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Shahida as a member of a two-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 48 years old and a rural villager residing in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang Province. He has four children, two of whom are students. To overcome the daily financial burden in the family, he has been farming rice, planting cassava, and growing corn for ten years. He and his wife are able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day from the current business.
Samet has not been with VisionFund in the past but he is now seeking an education loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to pay for his son’s tuition fees for the faculty of General Management. He hopes that this loan will provide financial support for his son, so he can focus on his studies and obtain a good job after the graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Muqadas' Group

texts.en: Muqadas is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business.
