Desea invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas  y además comprar baño lavable ya que por el momento no posee. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas de hierro para dar mayor seguridad a su familia y además, invertir en la compra de un baño sanitario lavable para mayor higiene y salud.  Espera poder contar con dicho apoyo ya que no posee los ingresos para hacerlo de manera independiente.
texts.en: Silvia, 24, is a single mother and lives with her young son in a house that she owns.  She works as a cleaner and makes enough to keep food on the table.  She has made a few improvements to her small house and now wants to install doors and windows for it.  She also wants to build a bathroom because she doesn't have one now.  She is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy steel doors and windows--an investment that will make her house more secure--and build a bathroom.  She is counting on your help because she lacks the resources to fund the work herself.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install secure doors and windows.

loans.name: Marta Rosa

texts.es: Marta tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual está constituido por su compañero de vida y sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su comunidad. Marta se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en el mercado de la comunidad donde habita. Cuenta con una casa muy humilde pero está muy contenta porque es propia y no tiene que estar pagando alquiler. Su vivienda necesita de algunas mejoras como lo es su servicio sanitario. Desea construir un cuarto  para cubrir el servicio sanitario ya que por el momento está cubierto por telas y plástico. Por esta razón solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Marta, 39, lives in her own home with her family, which includes her life partner and their children who go to the public school in their community. Marta makes a living by selling fresh fish in her community's market. She has a modest home but she's very happy because it's her own and she doesn't have to pay rent. Her home needs some improvements, including a bathroom. She wants to build a room to enclose the bathroom because it's currently enclosed with fabric and plastic. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized laminate, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, and nails to build bathroom walls.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man aged thirty-three years and he has two children aged six years and eight months. He owns and operates a grocery which contributes more than 85% of the money he uses to cater for the needs of his family. He works six days in a week and spends an average of 10 hours per day working. 

Julius started the grocery business in the year 2001 and has seen it grow to date. The grocery is located in Kyamamri, a local cell  in Bitooma sub-county, Bushenyi District and he hopes to use the loan funds to buy more grocery items which he intends to sell at a profit. In addition to the grocery in Kyamamari, he also has a butchery which he operates when he is off the grocery. His major clients are the people around him and he has high hopes of becoming financially stable since his challenge of lack of capital will be no more if he is given the loan. He describes himself as a hard-working man who hopes to achieve his goal in life.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Sinkor.  She is 43 years old, single, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 24 years old.  They live at home, and the two younger ones are in school. 

For four years now she has been selling batteries, soap, copy books, and pencils. She started this business from her savings.  She makes lots of profit and has many customers.

Faith is requesting a loan to purchase more batteries, soap, copy books, and pencils for her business. 

Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, soap, copy books, and pencils for her business.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 36 years old and married, the mother of seven. 

She is a hard-working woman and is in the business of tailoring. She has been doing it for two years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested  a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to meet the increasing demands of her customers. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en: Rithy is 34 years old and a married mother blessed with one son who is still in school. To struggle for a living, she plants cucumbers for resale as her main source of income; it is the business that she has had for 10 years. This is Rithy's fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success improving her living conditions. For this cycle, she is taking out an education loan to support her brother who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Engineering.  She will spend her entire loan to pay her younger brother's tuition fees. She hopes that her brother will get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for her younger brother's tuition fees

loans.name: Svet

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Svet is 33 years old and blessed with four children; two are in school and the remaining two are too young for schooling. The main source of her family's income is from rice farming on six hectares, which she has done for 10 years. Svet is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with this new loan. She repaid her past loan with success. The positive impact of her prior loan has enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now she is seeking a new loan of 1,800,000 KHR in order to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer, pay plowing fees, and buy herbicide for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her cash-crop and make more income.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her crops

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 55 years old. He is married with four children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: 19 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Kennya mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace 1 año y medio, El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de maíz  por quintal, flete de leña, cal. Angie mujer de 29 años de edad su negocio es la venta de nacatamales desde hace 3 años y Aracely mujer de 35 años su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three enterprising and hard-working members. One of the members is Kennya, 32, who is single with three children under her care. Her business is in selling tortillas from her home, which she has done for a year and a half. She is requesting this loan to buy corn by the quintal, firewood, and lime powder.

Angie, 29, has had a business selling nacatamales for three years and Aracely, 35, has had a small grocery store in her home for three years.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal, firewood, and lime powder.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is married with three children aged between four and ten. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She usually sells her ‘Wakye’ in Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ for 7 years. Ekua is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Wakye’. In the long term, Ekua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 37-year-old married woman. For about four years she has been work in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are high in demand, and she has managed to amass a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Saima dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana de 48 años de edad,  habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos uno de los cuales le ayuda en la economía del hogar. Juana es una mujer fuerte, trabajadora y responsable que a pesar de que su esposo y tres hijos  fallecieron en terremoto de 2001, ha sabido levantarse y hacer frente a la realidad  y toda la responsabilidad  con los hijos sobrevivientes.  Su principal patrimonio es su casita la cual necesita urgentemente cambio de techo ya que por las lluvias, y el viento se han deteriorado y no dan el soporte adecuado. Solicita éste crédito a FUSAI para hacer la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera que son los materiales necesarios para realizar la mejora.
texts.en: Juana, 48, lives with her three children--one of whom helps with household expenses--in a house that she owns.  She is a strong, hard-working, responsible woman who met the challenge of losing her husband and three other children in the 2001 earthquake.  Her most important material asset is her small house which urgently needs a new roof.  The strong winds and rains here have worn the roof down and the only solution is to repair it.  Juana is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the wood, nails and other materials that she needs to repair her roof.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and other materials for repairing her roof.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima de 31 años de edad, es casada y  junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar. Tiene 5 hijos de 12 años, 10 años, 8 años, 6 años y 1 año de edad.  Fátima es muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta fresca y pupusas (comida típica preparada a base de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.), habita en casa propia la cual es muy sencilla pero cuenta con las condiciones para proteger a su familia. Últimamente ha notado que el techo de su hogar no se encuentra en condiciones óptimas ya que cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera que le permita hacer el cambio de techo, con el fin de  continuar dando condiciones seguras a sus hijos.
texts.en: Fatima, 31, and her husband share the costs of supporting their family.  They have 5 children: 12-, 10-, 8-, 6- and 1-year(s) old, respectively.  Fatima is enterprising and hard-working.  She operates a business selling fresh fruit and pupusas (a traditional food made with corn, beans, cheese, etc.).  The family lives in a house that they own.  It's a small house, but important to and for them.  Fatima notes that the roof has begun to leak and she is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the wood, nails and other materials that she needs to replace it.  The investment will ensure that her children have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy the wood, nails and other materials that she needs to replace her roof.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
Darwin es un joven de 26 años de edad, esta acompañado y es padre de una niña de 6 años de edad, ha trabajado con su padre y tiene experiencia desde los 15 años de edad.  Actualmente, ha cumplido 16 años de ejercer la profesión de comerciante, aprendió la profesión de su papá, ya que se de dedicaba a la compra y venta de ganado, ademas el joven se de dedica al destazo y a la agricultura en pequeño.

Compra los animales (res y cerdos) para el destazo en el tiangué municipal, al momento de dichas compras él hace pagos en efectivo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 6 kilos de semilla de maíz mejorada, dos quintales de fertilizante Formula, dos de Urea y dos de Sulfato, todo esto porque cultiva 3,500 metros cuadrados de tierra. De esta manera, ira a suplir la necesidad de compra de semilla y 
fertilizantes para el trabajo agrícola que realiza. 


Se vera una notoria mejora en la calidad de alimentación y nutrición de su familia,  ya que obtendrá mejores resultados en la cosecha, y de esta forma no necesitara comprar granos para el consumo, y podrá invertir ese dinero en otra necesidad.


En el futuro, el joven Darwin planear haber terminado de pagar el crédito actual; y adquirir otro para ampliar el negocio de carnicería, y ser padre de otro hijo.
texts.en:
Darwin, 26, has a partner and a six-year-old daughter. He has worked with his father to gain 15 years of experience. He has now been working as a vendor for 16 years—a profession he learned from his father, who made a living buying and selling cattle. Darwin also works as a butcher and in agriculture. He buys animals (cows and pigs) for butchering in the small community market. He currently accepts payments in cash.

Darwin is requesting this loan to buy 6 kilos of better corn seeds, two quintals of Formula fertilizer, two of Urea, and two of Sulfato to cultivate 3,500 square meters of land.This will help him obtain the necessary seeds and fertilizer to complete his farming work.

He will then improve his family's quality of food and nutrition because he will have a better harvest. Also, he won't have to buy grains to eat and will be able to save that money for other necessities.

In the future, Darwin plans to finish making his loan payments and get another to increase his butchering business. He also plans to have another child.

loans.use: to buy 6 kilos of better corn seeds, two quintals of Formula fertilizer, two of Urea, and two of Sulfato to cultivate 3,500 square meters of land.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of six. She has been running a business trading in cloth for the past seven years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main market and then sells to the people of her village. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

Zareena has requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in the business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Mumtaz is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand on her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Kath

texts.en: Kath is 47 years old and she lives in Sinkor with four children ages 9 to 24. For 5 years now she has been selling slippers and  soap in the local market. She started this business by selling for her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She enjoys her business because it helps to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, oil and caustic soda for her business. She plans to build her house and help her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, oil and caustic soda for her business

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 35 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bananas and groundnuts in Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Efua is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bananas and groundnuts, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bananas and groundnuts, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase, age 46, is a father of four children, ages between four and twenty three. He has been in the business for the past five years. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs, and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.  Tiene tres años de dedicarse a la venta de mariscos y pescado en el mercado de su comunidad y muchos dan buenas referencias de ella ya que vende producto fresco a precios muy accesibles. Su casa es muy sencilla y su deseo es hacer un cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que no puede hacer la inversión por su cuenta pero con la venta de mariscos y la ayuda de su esposo tiene la seguridad de contar con la capacidad de pago de dicho compromiso.
texts.en: Maria, 37, lives with her husband and three children in a house that they own.  All of her children are in school.  Maria has operated a seafood sales business in her town's market for three years and her customers say that she provides good products at affordable prices.  Her house is small and she is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the wood, nails and other materials that she needs to build a new room.  She is counting on your help because she doesn't have enough funds to pay for the addition.  She is confident, she says, that she can repay the loan with help from her husband and income from her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a new room.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 36-year-old vigorous, married lady, and a mother of two children. She is doing a business of stitching clothes for many years. When she was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. 

Her husband is not an educated person, is a furniture manufacturer, and has no permanent monthly salary to support his family. She has good reputation in her community, and this business provides her with good opportunities to support her family.

Now she has requested to take a loan amount of PKR 35,000 to purchase a new sewing machine with some packs of threads in various colors. She dreams to provide higher education, good food, and healthy environment for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with packs of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 44-year-old client from Iraq. He is married and has no children. Anwar is a hard-working person, and tries his best to provide for his family all by himself.

Anwar owns a workplace where he sells timber blocks. These timbers are used for construction purposes. During the early phase of a building's construction, these timbers are needed in order to make the base of a building. 

Anwar has been in this field since 2000, and since then he became widely known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Anwar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to increase his inventory by buying more timbers. Anwar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to increase his inventory by buying more timber.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula  tiene 57 años de edad y se dedica al comercio. Su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su comunidad.  Es una mujer muy activa, dinámica y responsable. Su único patrimonio es su casa que junto a su hijo quien es albañil van mejorando poco a poco. Desea repellar las paredes de su casa ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias el ladrillo se está deteriorando y la humedad empieza a filtrarse. Solicita este crédito a FUSIA  para comprar cemento y arena para hacer el repello que tanto  necesita su casa. De esta forma protegerá su casa y a su familia.
texts.en: Paula, 57, operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in her town's market.  She is lively woman, dynamic and responsible.  Her only material asset is her house.  She and her son, a construction worker, have been slowly improving the house and her next project is replastering the outside walls.  Rain seeps through the walls because the old plaster has worn away with past rains and damaged the bricks that form the walls.  Paula is applying to FUSIA for a loan that she will use to buy the materials she needs to repair the cracks and replaster the walls of her house.  The investment will ensure that she has a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy materials for replastering the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory

loans.name: Jypar

texts.ru: Жыпар 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жыпар - среднее образование, работает техничкой в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жыпар занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также имеет земельный надел мерою 0,28 ГА, на котором выращивает многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корову для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Jypar is 49 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up three children. Jypar has a high school education. She works as a cleaner in a local school. As a source of additional income for her family, Jypar is engaged in raising livestock, having started eight years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Jypar today has on her homestead: one dairy cow, and also has an allotment of land measuring 0.28 hectares, on which she grows perennial grasses. Monthly incomes consists of 4,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Jypar turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase her livestock count. 

Jypar plans to invest income from the loan to further increase her quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nasimkan

texts.ru: Насимкан 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Насимкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Насимкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Насимкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 19 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насимкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Насимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nasimkan is 38 years old, married, and is bringing up four children with her husband. Nasimkan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Nasimkan is engaged in raising livestock, having started ten years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Nasimkan today has on her farm: one dairy cow, one calf, and 19 sheep. Monthly income consists of 7,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her homestead, Nasimkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her head count of cattle. 

Nasimkan plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing her count of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is a single mother of five children; none of her children goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a business of tailoring, and has been in this business for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (Uganda Shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, a new sewing machine, and threads.

She generates additional income through renting rooms and raring chicken. She works at her home seven days out of every week, and sells to all categories of people, but on retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a tailoring school and build more rental rooms. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

Her monthly expenses include school fees for the grand children and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials, new sewing machine, and threads.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 40-year-old married lady, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for PKR 35,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Shameem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko lives in Sinkor. She is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 16. Her children are in school and living at home. She is an 8th grade dropout. Her husband is a driver. 

For three years now, she has been selling oil and orange in the local market. She received a loan from a friend to start this business. She like the interaction with her customers. She says she is one of the good borrowers of BRAC Liberia. She is asking for a loan to buy more oil and orange to expands her business even more. 

Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more oil and orange to expands her business even more.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 47 years old. He is married and has six children, aged between one and fourteen years. He has been in the business of farming for the past 20 years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the plants' production of maize. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he will be able to acquire machines and tractors that would enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 29 лет. Он состоит в браке и имеет детей. Махмадали занимается растениеводством. Параллельно он хочет разводить мелкорогатый скот для продажи, поскольку его семья год за годом расширяется и ему уже не хватает на семейные расходы. Для начала бизнеса Махмадали запрашивает кредит и планирует закупить 5 голов овец. Он собирается откармливать их в течение месяца и когда они наберут достаточный вес, Махмадали продаст их на скотном рынке. Весь процесс будет проходить у него на скотном дворе, то есть ему не придется платить за аренду пастбища. Вот такие планы у Махмадали. Махмадали по натуре ответственный и целеустремленный человек. У него должно все получиться.
texts.en:
Mahmadali is a resident of the J.Rumy region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has children. Mahmadali is involved in agriculture. In parallel, he wants to raise livestock for resale, because his family is expanding year after year and it is not enough to cover family expenses. 

To start a business, Mahmadali is requesting a loan and plans to buy five head of sheep. He is going to fatten them over the course of a month and when they gain enough weight, Mahmadali will sell them at the livestock market. This process will take place in his farmyard, that is, he will not have to pay rent for pastures. 

These are Mahmadali's plans. By nature, Mahmadali is a responsible and goal-oriented person. Through him everything will turn out.

loans.use: to buy five head of sheep to start a sheep farming business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 44 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Yasmeen’s husband, who is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Yasmeen has applied for a loan of Rs 35,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Yasmeen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Safia is a married woman and mother of seven children. She deals in the business of animal sale and purchase. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation, and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Sero

texts.en:
Sero is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance – Ishaka Branch. He is a mechanic who has done mechanics for the last 13 years. He works six days per week and four hours per day. His clients are mainly car owners, who take their cars to him so that he can repair them. In addition to the mechanic type of business, he is also a driver, and this makes him more money to support his family. He started mechanics work in 2000 with the hope of being able to sustain his family.

Sero plans to use the loan funds of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy equipment to use in his business so that he can make more income. He hopes that in future he will also buy another car and a stronger car. Unstable income is his major challenge, but he hopes to overcome this with time – especially if he gets this loan and makes more money from the business.

In the photo is the client (left) and UGAFODE staff, posing by the car he is using as security.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат кредитуется в ИМОНе повторно. Она честная и порядочная  женщина. Зумрат имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она более 18 лет работает в заводе по разработки алюминий. Она работает в качестве контролером над техникой в химической лаборатории. Она сама воспитывает сына, так как ее муж развелся с нею и женился на другой женщине. Ее сын учится в университете в городе Казане. Ему 19 лет. Зумрат тоже имеет высшее образование. Она начитанная и умная женщина. Зумрат хочет купить бытовую технику для домохозяйства. Однако она не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки бытовой техниками. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zumrat is a repeat borrower at IMON. She is an honest and decent woman. Zumrat has a good credit history. For more than 18 years, she has been working in a aluminum production. She works as a supervisor of technicians in the chemical laboratory. 

She is bringing up her son on her own, because her husband divorced her and married another woman. Her son is studying in a university in the town of Kazan. He is 19 years old. 

Zumrat also has a higher education. She is a well-read and clever woman. Zumrat wants to buy home appliances for the household. However, she does not have enough money. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy household appliances.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen lives at Sinkor, in Montserrado County, the county where the capital city of Liberia is located. It is well-known as the commercial center of Liberia. She is 46 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 5 and 18, who are in school and live at home.

For the past years, she has been running a business at a table in the market, where she sells clothes. She started this business with help from her father, and she learned this way of selling from him. She like her business, because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She wants to earn more money, to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 51-year-old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past five years, she has been running business of clothing sales. She buys clothes of different fabrics, in various colors and designs. She buys them from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of Rs 50,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She will use it to buy a wide variety of clothes, in different colors and designs, to expand her inventory and attract more customers.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes, in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

Her husband also assists her in purchasing stocks of good from the market. She is a mother of 6 children, and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase business capital. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар родился в 1955 года. Он работал в государственном учреждении. Данное время он пенсионер и получает ежемесячно пенсию. Его жена работает медсестрой в больнице района. Они воспитывают 3 детей. Музаффар выделяет огромное внимание на образование своих детей. Его сын учится на 5 курсе Национального Университета Таджикистана. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muzaffar was born in 1955. He worked in a public institution. Currently, he is retired and receives a monthly pension. His wife works as a nurse in the district hospital. They are raising three children. 

Muzaffar gives a lot of attention to the education of the children. His son is in the 5th year at the National University of Tajikistan. He needs to pay his son's tuition. He is requesting a loan to pay tuition for his son.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is 38 years old and sells liquid soap as well as other stain-removing detergents. She has been a detergents dealer in Miritini, Mombasa for the last four years, is married and the mother of two children. She is requesting her third loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business and will use it to buy  detergents such as liquid soap in bulk for re-sale in small quantities. She will use the money she expects to earn to pay back her loan and meet her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy liquid soap in bulk and re-package small quantities for re-sale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 43 años, está casado con Guadalupe. Ambos tienen un hijo con quien viven en su casa propia. Hace 16 años, esté trabajador hombre se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ovino, vacuno y porcino; los cuales engorda y mata, para luego comercializarlo en su carnicería que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación adquirió en el mercado modelo de su ciudad; los días de mayor venta son los jueves y domingos. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Rolando, él también incursionó hace 3 años, al trasporte público, obteniendo un ingreso extra; cuenta que mientras trabaja todos los días con el auto, su esposa se dedica al negocio de carnes. Ahora él está pensando adquirir un auto mejor implementado, con el que podrá trasportar a los pobladores de la ciudad al campo, asimismo está pensando adquirir máquinas para cortar carne, y así tener una carnicería de producción; con embutidos de toda variedad, con ello espera tener mejores ingresos para darle a su hijo una educación de nivel. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rolando, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la comprá de varios kilos de carne de animal, ovino, vacuno y porcino. Con esto piensa abastecerá su carnicería como acostumbra.
texts.en:
Rolando, 43, is married to Guadalupe. They have a son whom they live with in their own house. This hard-working man has been making a living for 16 years buying and selling livestock: sheep, cows, and pigs, which he fattens and kills in order to sell them in his butcher´s shop. He acquired this shop in the model market of his city, with much effort and dedication. The days with the greatest sales are Thursdays and Sundays. 

But Rolando does not only make a living as a butcher. He also ventured into public transport three years ago, obtaining an extra income. He says that every day while he works with the car, his wife works in the butcher´s shop. Now he is thinking of acquiring a better-equipped car, with which he will be able to transport city people to the countryside. He is also thinking of acquiring machines for cutting meat, so that he will have a more productive butcher´s shop with all kinds of sausages, with which he hopes to earn a better income so that he can give his son an education.

This is his sixth loan with Kiva, which is why he is thankful for the financial support provided to him. It will help him to make progress in his business. He also promises to be punctual with his loan payments. Rolando will invest the 3000 soles in the purchase of several pounds of animal meat (lamb, beef and pork), with which he will supply his butcher´s shop as usual.

loans.use: to buy wholesale meat

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso, es una persona de 64 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo.  Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 18 años de edad, cuenta con 46 años de experiencia en la agricultura y desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte, debido a que posee con vehículo propio, lo cual le facilita para trasportar personas a los diferentes lugares.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la reparación del motor del del vehículo, que debido al trabajo diario que él realiza con su vehículo, el motor comenzó a presentar fallas, y de esta manera le imposibilita concluir con su trabajo diario. 


El señor Narciso mejora su fuente de ingresos, y dará un servicio de mejor calidad a sus clientes.

Él planea haber terminado de pagar el préstamo, y tramitar otro para la compra de un vehículo mas moderno, para continuar prestando el servicio de transporte.
texts.en:
Narciso is a 64 year old widower, and he has one son.  He has been farming since he was 18 years old.  He says that he has 46 years of experience in farming.  For the last ten years he has been providing transportation services with his own vehicle.  He uses his vehicle to transport people to different places.

The loan that he is requesting is to repair his vehicle’s motor.  Due to the daily work that he does with his vehicle, it has started to have problems, which make it impossible to complete his daily work.  Narciso will improve his source of income, and he will give his customers a better quality of service.

When he has completed repayment of the loan, he plans to negotiate another in order to buy a more modern vehicle.  He will do this in order to continue providing transportation service.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's motor.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 40-year-old married woman who runs a successful livestock business. She also sells milk to generate extra income. Her husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family. That is why Robina buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up then sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with support from the Kashf Foundation, and is requesting a loan for Rs. 35,000 to buy two more calves. This is her sixth loan and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing her family with a better standard of living by working hard at her business.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran, age 37, deals in livestock buying and selling. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. She will use the loan to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats to raise and sell
